The Grand Bazaar is also easily reachable by foot and there is a very efficient tram service which can take you to the Pera district and beyond. Close by there is also an underground station which one uses to get to the Asian side if one wants to avoid the boat transfer. The area is full of very good restaurants with magnificent terraces.For all these convenient reasons we found that, unlike other areas, Sultanahmet is the perfect base to visit Istanbul by foot.

Surrounded by antiquities!. To stand between Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet Square and to be in the District was quite surreal. From the beautiful flower beds and fountains to the sellers with their carts selling baked goods the atmosphere is just amazing. The Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace are all located in this historic district and you will find yourself wanting more time to explore and savour what this beautiful area has to offer.

"Vibrant and bustling area, great for people watching". Always feels like "the place to be" for locals & tourists alike. Interesting photo ops and a good hub for meeting with friends, impromptu activities or just people watching.

beautiful. If you are a history buff then this the place to be. Absolutely beautiful and the best of both modern and old have been combined. Don't forget to take your shoes off and bring along a head scarf while entering the mosque

A lovely area to stroll around. We were joined a cruise ship at Istanbul, so only had one day in port, which happened to be an Eid in Turkey, so the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and other attractions were closed until after lunch time. This had it's advantages though as we were able to stroll around the area, which was unusually quiet at the time, and see the buildings from the outside. We were able to go into the courtyard of the Blue Mosque, but by the time the attractions were open large queues built up and we did not feel inclined to join those queues,Instead we had a lovely lunch in a Trip Advisor listed rooftop restaurant which was a small way up a side street fro the main Sultanahmet area. We followed lunch with a stroll through the city down towards the bridge which went over to the cruise ships and picked a tram up from there back to our ship. We are pleased about what we chose to do as we had a relaxing day exploring Istanbul. We would love to return and see the attractions as well and really hope that we are able to do so. If travel is restricted in the future, it will be a great shame for both tourists and locals alike as tourism is important to the ecconomy in Turkey.

THE PLACE TO BE/STAY IN ISTANBUL. This is the area you want to stay near when visiting Istanbul. All the major sites are located within walking distance of each other - Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, the Blue Mosques, the obelisk, the hippodrome, etc. When looking for a hotel check out this area and Sirkeci which is right next door (easy walking distances - lots of boutique and small hotels, lots of restaurants, cafes, shops, cobblestoned small streets, etc.).
beautiful architecture. Unfortunately, the attractions were closed when I was strolling around the streets, but i would want to visit again.

Excellent tourist attraction. Sultanahmet is one of my favorite places. I can walk and enjoy a beautiful view of local people, surrounded by local cafe. Sultanahmet is the oldest part of the city where people just like to be there, for just hanging around with friends, or just sitting atthe cafe corner and enjoying a wind breeze. This area was giving me a memorable experience. People are friendly and i will surely going back someday
Such a beautiful area.. I never got tired of this area. You can sit and just people watch or visit the Blue Mosque, Haigue Sophia, or a number of other locations.

sultanamat. sultanahmet trip 2014 I went on a tour of sultanahmet with my parents in september of 2014-greate weather . sunny greate people too.we went with the Abercrombie and kaent Travel agency. everywhere we went we where greeted nicely. i love taking pictures when i travel. i took alot of nice pictres day and night.i remember going out to eat on my last night there and it was cool at night. i sugest taking a light jacket.i did not have one and i was cold.fortunately at the restaurant we wen. they gave me a pashmina to cover myself. i was two blocks from my hotelso i was ok.they you ven told me to take the pashmina with me and they would go pick it up at the hotel.you can walk around town with no problema.the agra sofia museum is fantastic-you can not miss going there. you can go in and out all day.sinci was on a private tour. we went two days to do everything.the weather when i went was fantastic. sunny and not to warm.
A neighborhood to visit. It's a great place where you have the 3 most amazing site seeing as well as great coffee shops and restaurants. It is a must. You could have a nice walk as well and enjoy it

important to see. This is the oldest part of the city, and is important to see for that reason alone. Restaurants and shops in this neighborhood are best avoided, and don't fall for the pressures from restaurant owners and shopkeepers to come in a try their place - it's likely to be disappointing. But the area itself is lovely, and there is much to see. I
So much history!. The place to not only visit inhistoric Istanbul, but to stay as well. It's all here: Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the underground water basilica....

Bad tour. I went on a Sultanahmet area tour by Turista Tours of Istanbul. Turista Tours is incompetent and their staff are rude. The tour came about in the following way.For my stay in Istanbul, I worked with Memphis Tours ofCairo, Egypt and as the local subagent for Turkey, Castle Travel of Kusadasi,Turkey, and I guess I will have nothing to do with either ofthem ever again. To provide me with a tour of the main attractionsin Istanbul, they linked me up with Turista Tours with an office in Sultanahmet.Dealing with the Turista office is miserable. The organization of the tour was mindless. First, we had to walk about .8km from their office to the Blue Mosque. Then we had to walk about a kilometer up the "touts' alley," the Hippodrome, to Hagia Sophia. Then we had to walk back down the same kilometer to"lunch" (which was mediocre). Then we were supposed to walk once more up the samekilometer to the "cistern." Kilometer after kilometer of pointlesswalking instead of seeing all the sights in one area at a time. What moron designed this tour? I dropped out before the cistern because my feet could not do anymore. A kindly Australian fellow traveler consideratelyalso dropped out and gave me use of his tram pass so that Idid not miss the last sight on the tour, which was two tramstops away, the Grand Bazaar.   I am 62 years old and this sure was a poor arrangement for me. Let me note also that both Turista and Castle Travel are so incompetent that they wrote on my itinerary that the same tour would also include Topkapi Palace, yet they scheduled this tour for a Tuesday--the one day of the week when the palace is never open. And they scheduled my visit toBaylerbeyi Palace in Istanbul also on the one day of theweek when it is not open! During the Sultanahmet tour, I asked the tour guide to use hiscellphone to call Turista's office and let me talk tothe manager about rescheduling the tours that wereincorrectly scheduled. He complied, but the manager at Turista Travelis so rude that he said, "I don't want to talk toyou." Yeah? You don't want to listen to acustomer? Well, ok, buddy, I will talk to others. I advisetravelers to Istanbul to avoid Turista Tours like theplague.

Argueably the best zone in Istanbul. I always like to return to Istanbul just because of this district. Sure , it's full of tourists but that has a reason. Most of the typical ottoman architecture is on this side and is a MUST for every tourist.
Everything is in a walking distance. Best area in Istanbul to stay in. Everything in a walking distance.. nice resturants and lovely atmosphere.
nice place. a must visit in istanbul..the style and architecture are very beautiful. a crowded area though but worth visiting

Tourist-landia. Convenient to stay in this neighbourhood, but you'll get tourist treatment when you walk around through the main street. Better to breeze through here, see the main attractions, then visit more authentic places.

The tourist district; full of beautiful historic sites, bustling bazaars, and tourist traps (beware).. A must visit while in Istanbul - this is the area where you will find many of the major historical and tourist sites and bazaars. There are many restaurants and baklava shops, though better ones can be found in other areas. Beware if catching a taxi over here, you may incur "tourist" rates! People selling things in this area will come out of their shops and confront you about looking or buying at their wares or food (just for your information) (carpet/rug shop owners are especially aggressive). The area is quite large but can be easily navigated if you have your bearings. Be prepared to walk a good bit between sites.
Bustling. So many alleys and side roads, one could walk around for a day. This area is full of historical buildings and has an energetic feel, locals going about their business and tourist en masse.

Center of it All. The Sultanahmet District is quintessential old Istanbul. After visiting once, you feel transported into another time and place. I have visited here perhaps five times and each time have discovered new things that make me keep on coming back. I would suggest getting a hotel in this area and explore by food.
Historic. best of the est and west. you get the bazaar feel, and the cafe bistro feel. can literally walk to several tourist places.

Best area to stay in. So much going on all the time. Great food places that stay open till late. Nice place to stay in. The area has great shisha places to visit and entertainment going on all the time. I would recommend staying in this area rather than the new modern area of Istanbul which is Taksim square area.
A gathering place of interest!. Love Istanbul and this is an interesting gathering place. Restaurants, shops and teeming with people of all cultures.

Heart of Ottomans. This area used to be the heart of Ottomans as well as the Byzantium Empire. There are several historical sights to visit such as Topkapi Palace, Roman Basilica, Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia. Worth visiting.

Great place. We stayed here for the duration of our visit to Istanbul. Very attractive place with all the attractions one would expect to see. Restaurants and shops are easily accessible.
Public transport is convenient and close to hotels and restaurants. Beautiful area, tourist friendly.

Melting Pot. This is so busy an area locals and tourists you get the boats across the river, the markets are here where you can buy gifts, herbs spices or just about anything. lots of restaurants and small cafes which offer good local food at reasonable prices. It does get very crowded because locals do their shopping here.

Fabulous, vibrant and fascinating.. This is the most amazing and interesting area, full of historic buildings and with access to the colourful and vibrant markets and the Grand Bazaar. This is a flourishing cosmopolitan city with the advantage of the nearby Bosphorus to hand. It truly is where east meets west and this can be seen on a daily basis. The sounds, smells and daily culture are a pleasure to behold. Definitely worth a visit! I will be returning as one week is definitely not enough. Must do's....Bus tour of Istanbul with boat trip and find a restaurant with a roof top terrace in Sultanahmet square.The views are totally incredible!
great city. I've been on touristic tour sightseeing sultanahmet- old city. We've been in blue mosque, hypodrome square, topkapi palace etc..all in all- what a wonderfull city, full of charm...

The hub of the city. Sultanahmet district is the center of the city with lots of shops, cafes, restaurants and touristic attractions. You can also visit historical monuments: Hagia Sophia, Topkapi etc.

Great place to Stay for travelers.. Sultanahmet District have got several attractions in Istanbul and might be the best choice to stay for travelers. The place is full of historical places like famous mosques, museum, squares. Besides the place offers a bundle of shopping options, with traditional and road side shops. Lots of Turkish food varieties are also at your door steps here. There are plenty of hotels as well. Though a bit high in price, it worth staying, as the attractions are nearby. If you plan to stay long, you can choose a hotel with wonderful views.
Cultural Center of Istanbul, Turkey. Framed by the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, this is the cultural center of Turkey and the most popular tourist site in that country.

The most happening area of Istanbul!. I was traveling with friends to Istanbul when we decided to stay at Sultanahmet district and it was the best decision! There are so many pretty shops and multi-cuisine restaurants in the area. It's modern but has an old world charm at the same time.

Best place to be at in Istanbul.. If you are visiting Istanbul for the first time and want to visit most of the historical monuments then this is the place to stay at. All the famous sites like the Blue Mosque, museums, Topkapi Palace, Ayasofiya etc. are all walking distance. You will benefit from a Museums Pass easily available here from the vending machines and some of the best Turkish restaurants in close vicinity.
be careful AND enjoy. The news is scary and events happening around the neighborhood are scary, but this part of old Istanbul is a treasure if you can visit. Our family had a wonderful time.

I was lucky today.... I stayed in Sultanahmet and went with my daughter to the Blue Mosk at 10am on Tuesday. As we arrived with a loud bang was heard. A bomb blast has just happened, killing people. We were ushered away by security and were not able to go to the Blue Mosk as the whole district was cordoned of by hundreds of security forces with machine guns. The whole area from Topkapi to the Blue Mosk could not be entered the whole day.
A MUST VSIT CITY. Fascinating cultural clashes, east and west. Lots to do and see, costs of eating out very reasonable, friendly people, a must add to your bucket list.

Wonders all around . This area in Istanbul is exceptionally rich in culture and history. The Blue Mosque , Aya Safia , Topkapi Palace , cisterns and obelisk amongst other must see sights in Turkey are located here. The Grand Bazaar is one tram stop away and the area is abound with restaurants and hotels and is probably the best place to stay as all these sights become within a 5 min walk of each other.

The most happening district of Istanbul. from shopping to leisure stroll; from culture to food; from mosques to waterside attractions; sultanhmet district of istanbul is the most happening part of this beautiful city - not to be missed!

Heart of the old city!. Most of the sites that you have to visit in Istanbul are all located in the Sultanahmat: Hagia Sofia, The blue mosque, Basilica cisterne and of cource the Topkapi palace. All of it is located within walking distance to each other and of all the before mentioned sites are all places that you must visit! Bunch of young people wearing blue t-shirts labelled "ask me" are loccated throughout this district and are very helpful in guiding and helping you with whatever you need. They are however probably the only people that speaks english, since most turks doesnt speak english.

By far the most charming area in Istanbul!. I stayed here during my first visit to Istanbul over 2 years ago. Even though the second time I stayed in the posh (and very convenient) Nisantasi area, I still believe that Sultanahmet is the best. It's so charming and atmospheric and people are especially nicer. Yes, it's not the most convenient for a long stay or for great dining spots, but it's hands-down the best for morning (Or evening. Or night!) strolls around the quaint side-streets. Totally recommended for a first/short stay.
Istanbul attraction. Nice place in Istanbul old town. Lots of Islamic historical attractions in this area. Pretty sure, you will enjoy to move around the corner of this place.

Beautiful. The district is very beautiful, and well managed. I have to commend the municipality for being visible as well.
The place is rather busy, so if you have children you will need to keep an eye on them.
No taxis or transport required here.. Walk from site to site and take in as much as you can. This old district is very alive and fun to be in.
The architecture. Great architecture, and you can appreciate the view of the Mosque from near and far. It is a bit modern, but offers a great scene.
Vibrant historic area. It is part of old Istanbul. Many historic sites are to be seen. You can spend a whole day in that district. Easily accessible using Tramway.
Heaven. Romantic, beautiful, clean, friendly. One of my favourite places on the planet! It really is a must see place and the perfect location to stay and explore Istanbul from.

Excellent part of Turkey to stay!. This district- referred to as the old district - has a lot of tourist sights such as Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and Arista Bazaar. There are many great restaurants and it feels very safe.

THE REAL HEART OF OTTOMAN ISTANBUL. So much to see and admire. The list is endless and you can spend a week just visiting all the sights and re-living the history and eating the Turkish/Ottoman cuisine.Everything is available in the Sultanahmet general area and within walking distance or a short taxi ride including the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, the Mosques and a little farther Galata Tower, the Golden Horn, Pera Palace Hotel, Dolmabahce Palace and the Bosphorus and Islands etc etc.Personally I would stay in a Boutique Hotel in Sultanahmet and live the life to the full.

Historical and Peaceful .... Very lively place to stay while in istanbul …peaceful with the locals ever willing to help ….lots of antique shops to get traditional carpets ,lamps ,clothes etc and good places to eat too….especially sea food at reasonable price too
Loved visiting this area. So much to see in this part of Istanbul. Many significant sites all within walking distance to the hotels

place to live during your holiday. very lively and intersting place, if you live in this distict then all the attractions,transport,shops and restuants are there, we have really enjoyed walking on the squire at night beautiful clean and lively place...

Ancient, accessible, interesting. Surprisingly easy to get around and an amazing amount of ancient history to experience. Yes, the rug sellers and other hawkers circle the tourists, but it doesn't really detract from the experience. Having studied art in college it was fascinating to walk slowly and take it all in.

Definitely worth seeing the extravagance of the Sultan. You can see the extravagance and learn about the Sultan who occupied this landmark. It is quite amazing to see how luxury is translated into different eras and different cultures.

Bustling with Locals and Tourist.. A Must See Area with many Attractions. This area is bustling with tourists and locals. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia Museum, The Basilica Cistern and The Saltanahmet Square are within walking distance. Better to see the Cistern early in the day when there is some natural light penetrating the darkness within. The above mentioned attractions are best experienced early in the day during the short day light winter months. The Blue Mosque requires you to cover your knees and elbows... A head scarf for women. At given times during the day prayers may effect your visiting time. Hagia Sofia is a museum therefore the restrictions regarding dress code do not apply. The cistern is a must see. The beauty of the Justinian structure is breathtaking. Fish are seen swimming beside the walkway. This area is touristy, but cheap eats at food stalls and reasonably priced restaurants are found in the nearby streets.

Touristy but this is still where you want to go to visit. Sultanhamet certainly is where a lot of what you want to see is. Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofya, The Blue Mosque, it's all here. But it's not where I would want to stay. In December when we visited, we were not inundated with the shill, but I can see how it would be much worse in the high season. And we did get a good dose of it when it came to things like eating. So do come and visit. Come and see everything and enjoy it. But then leave it. Because there's plenty of other terrific areas of Istanbul to go to and enjoy as well. And you might like them much more.

Visit again. It is one of the most romantic place I know..The cobbled street takes u to a different time. The friendly people...The smell of food ..and the streets lined with road side cafes. U can't get enough of this place...The mouthwatering food ..and when u leave....u will be promising yourself a trip back again....
nice one. it was so big and so beautiful..i really enjoyed being there. the accesability via metro is easy but the station is not really near the place and you should walk anyway.

A happening place in Istanbul. We stayed in the Sultanahmet district during our visit and the place is amazing. First of all 4 of the best attractions in Istanbul are in Sultanahmet - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Basilica Cisterns and The Topkapi Palace. Plus there is a huge market just stone's throw from the Blue Mosque.Sultanahmet is the perfect blend of history and modern age. One one hand you have the monuments that are hundreds of years old; telling the rich story of Istanbul while just at walking distance you have a Burger King. A very nice place to stay, shop and enjoy!We visited in August 2014.

Love the area, but avoid shops and restaurants!. This is a great area with a lot of history. You can spend hours roaming around the place, as it is full of historic places. Still, I would not recommend entering any shops or cafes and restaurants as they are very much overpriced. Enter them to see how this works first hand, and realise how little effort they put into tricking you into buying things, or charging you 100-150% more than in places a few streets down the hill.

Historical!. This is great place to work around in Istanbul. You may find the historical resemblance in every corner of the street. Bustling streets with everything you can buy and many tourist attractions. Take your time to visit the district and sit around to enjoy the best Doner Kebab..

Lovely place!. The Sultanahmet mosque is in the heart of downtown Turkey and is opposite to the Blue Mosque and most attractions and activity can be found around this area. The mosque itself is very peaceful and has lots of small shops and markets around it.

Sultanahmet is worth even a week. We spent a relaxed week and enjoyed just strolling around this district with some neighbor-ones. Many places were quite crowded, but we liked just watching daily live on streets, in bazaars and at churches/mosque (hope that's rigth translation). Inside the district we mainly walked around. We always found nice little take-aways if focusing on places with 'locals'.One should be aware that everybody wants to make a deal ;-) Watch out for people lossing their shoe-brush :-) If we'd get back, we'll pick the district again, even if in winter there was still a lot of tourism.
Nice historic place . Nice historic buildings and mosques, but very busy and extreme amounts of tourists. A half day is enough. There are som nice market streets for those who like that.

Only place to stay. This heart of old Istanbul is the perfect place to stay. Short walks take you to most historic sites and easy access to trams and subway connects to the rest of this most intriguing city.
Nice place to see!. If you were on Istanbul, first place for look, it is Sultanahmet area. Hystorical Old Town, which is belonging for centuries.

a great place to stay. I have often stayed in the Sultanahmet area, close to the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. It is such an historical region of the city that it can continue to fascinate. Just take care with the usual touting but it seems inoffensive at most, just people trying to do a job. There are good restaurants, most are local cuisine.

The place to be. The Times Square of Istanbul. If you've been to the city, chances are you've been here. All the top tourist attractions tend to be either in this district or pretty close to it. Full of restaurants, souvenir shops, home to the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace and a stone's throw distance to the grand bazaar. Lovely ambiance. Friendly people all round. If you're planning a trip to Istanbul, make sure your hotel is close by. Only down side is, everything seems to be twice as expensive compared to the outskirts. But I suppose, that is true for most tourist driven areas in the world.

Gorgeous and worth seeing. In the center of town there is no reason not to stop by and see this mosque. This one not only shows you beautiful architecture but a peek into what an active mosque is like. Worth stopping by.

Back in time. It is impossible to visit Istanbul and not visit the Sultanameth quarter. Whether it is for history, atmosphere , architecture this is where to go (apart from an additional visit of the great bazar).

Nice historic area but a little to busy for my taste. Wonderful historic buildings and mosques, but very busy and extreme amounts of tourists. A half day is enough. There are som nice market streets for those who like that.

Charming. I could walk around the small streets in the old city for hours and not get bored. It seems like mostly tourists, but there is no way around that. Lots of vendors trying to sell you things, many in what I would call a passive aggressive way. Lots of street food.

A Lovely part of historic Istanbul. This is probably the most interesting and historical parts of Istanbul.
Many mosques and other sights are there to visit in walking distance.
Beautiful. Beautiful city with old elements. You should definitely go eat in Sultanahmet Koftecisi right across the mosque. They make amazing kofte for only 17 lira.
Interesting. When in Istanbul you need to make sure that you spend at least one day in Sultanahmet Area where every corner is filled with ages of history.

The center of Istanbul.. a place where you can enjoy a Dondurma or a Turkish Alma tea while sightseeing almost all the famous places such as:1- The blue Mosque.2-Hagia Sophia.3-Topkapi Palace.Where you can see Prophet Muhammad's Sword,foot print, and his tooth. And Joseph's turban, David's sword. John's stuff. Muhammad's daughter Fatima's dress. His grandson Hussain's dress. and all the Sacred relics.4- The Egyptian spice market.

Not to be missed!. Nothing I had read prepared me for how incredibly beautiful and so well preserved Sultanahmet is. It is a great balance between Centuries old sites of incredible beauty and historic significance, boulevards, narrow streets with fascinating architecture and vibrant restaurants! It is up there with the beauty of Rome and best of London!

Must stay in this historic district. If you want to stay in Istanbul, this is the place to stay. Get a hotel here, and every place is at a walking distance. We visited one or two places in the morning, took a leisurely lunch, then a nap, and out again in the evening. Spend your evening in the square of grand mosque and Hagia Sophia, just watching people. Numerous good places to eat in the vicinity. We even walked all the way to Galata, crossed the Galata bridge on foot.

Heart of Istanbul. All the main attractions are within walking distance and public transportation using buses and tram is easy.Stay somewhere in sultanahmet to make use of the best spots. Enjoy turkish food and overcrowded markets. Foods to Try:-Baklava - a Turkish sweet Non veg - KebabsTurkish Tea, Turkish CoffeeKumpir - a loaded baked potatoTavuk Göğsü - Turkish chicken breast puddingBörek - a traditional Turkish pastry made of flaky doughLokum - Turkish delightAyran - national drink in Turkey and it is a cold yogurt beverage with saltDoner - a dish made with meat cooked on a spinning vertical rotisserieLahmacun - considered to be the Turkish equivalent of pizzaDondurma - Turkish Ice cream. Also known as MaraşPomegranate juice
A perfect example of turkish islamic architecture!. With a long history expanding over years, been a center of all three monotheistic religions: Christianity, Islam and Judaism. Traveled in 2013

Old Istanbul. The Sultanahmet District is a must see in Istanbul. The sites are amazing and well kept. The Blue Mosque is open to visitors, except during prayer. The best part for me was the surprise of walking through the old Hippodrome and seeing the old Egyptian Obelisks taken from Egypt, brought to Constantinople in 300 AD. There are only 30 in the world now, most in Rome and Egypt and a few scattered through Europe. The Hagia Sophia was gorgeous. Nice to walk around and just enjoy, but hard to get a great photo o the ground level. Have to be creative to capture the beauty of the buildings. Food and shopping are good, but the best restaurant is Buhara 93. It is on the opposite side of the Blue Mosque after walking through the Hippodrome. Local, great value and amazing food.

A must see in Istanbul. Beautiful architecture. Admission is 30 turkish lira (US$10). You can easily combine a visit to Sultanahmet by tram (tram stop: Sultanahmet for 4 turkish lira) to visit Topkapi Palace, Sophia Hagia, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern in one day.

Stunning area with vibrant streetlife. A wonderful area full of shops, cafes, bars, and ancient historic sights. Just beware of everyone trying to bring you to their family shops to sell you expensive rugs!

HIstoric area. There is nothing specific to rate as it's a large area but this is a must see area if you are visiting Istanbul. Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Cisterns, the Grand Bazaar and much much more are in this area.

A must when in Istanbul . A beautiful area filled with history. Wished we had done a tour as would've appreciated the structures more!
Lots of great cafes and shops!
nice district. I think is the most quiet , safest and most historic district to stay when you visit istanbul! Near to Hagia sofia and Grand Bazaar

corridors full of surprises. Don't take the main streets, walk and get lost in the labyrinth of small side streets. Ask if you may take pics before you do so freely- they will alway accept and love you more for asking beforehand.

Serene in bustling, busy area. I simply love this area. I love sitting around the blue mosque/Haga Sophia watching the world passes by. I could sit there for hours people watching and also there i find inspiration and aspiration. I always walk away feeling refreshed and relaxed.

Great pedestrian dominated open spaces area with top historic sites within. Safe .. Prime historic Istanbul area. Great area to stay in . The Old city . Lots of good walks to sites and plenty of restaurants. Beautiful safe clean area. Make sure your hotel is in Old City. Short tram ride to sea ferries or shopping areas. Wonderful area.

Worth exploring on foot!. The Sultanahmet is more than just the palace, the Hagia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque. It is the part of the city that goes back all the way to the founding, and that has lived different lives under the Greeks, the Romans, the Byzantines, and the Ottomans. Get a good guide book, like John Freeley's Strolling Through Istanbul, and get to know the smaller monuments and littel alleyways, not just the big attractions.

Fun and busy.... There is alot to see and it is the center to lots of historical landmarks and walkable distance to everything from the Grand Bazaar to the Basilica. There are many quaint hotels in the area, many boasting views. The eating is like discovering many treasures. If looking for home cooking, visit the Osmanli restaurant!
COLORFUL PLACE. This district of Istanbul is a very colorful place full of different shops, restaurants and tourist attractions. It is alive with activity day or night.
Sultanahmet. Tourist area.......with a lot attraction...... First preference to visit in Istanbul.... Worth to visit nice place for holiday

Can't miss it. Beautiful views, lots of interesting monuments to see, skyline is picture perfect. You will be approached, just say no thank you, you don't want to see a carpet etc. Also, be aware of shoe shiners dropping their brush as they are walking in front of you, when you pick it up and return it to them, they will shine your shoes as a thank you and then expect you to pay 20 lira. As is any large city - be aware of your surroundings.
Just amazing. Most important places of the whole city very close together.Unlike rest of the city quite clean.Definitely worth to see!Just follow the tram and you can see everything you need :)

Most beautiful district of istanbul . Most beautiful district of istanbul for those who looking to sea old istanbul and feel the magic of orient.I have visited istanbul many times and i stayed in many districts, but sultanahmat was the best.You have alot of activities and places you can go there by walking.Also there are alot of hotels, restaurants, cafes, with different stars levels.there are many tour offices can offer you alot of tour program inside and outside istanbul.

Shopping . Shopping is Amazing in this area. Remember to negotiate! Most of the items in this area are handmade of great quality. You will definitely go back in time in this area with cobblestone roads and ancient building. Must go!

Simply Awesome!. Highly recommended. The place is magical. In very close proximity you visit many landmarks, A MUST TO DO thing in Istanbul.Its recommended to opt for a tour guide that speaks your native language. This is bound to enhance you experience, as a whole.Also, better renting a hotel in the area as its takes minimum 2 to 3 days to see all this area offers. Do consider the Traveler Card that will not only save money but will also help you bypass long queues during seasonal rush.
Family holiday. An amazing place to explore by foot.From the blue mosque to the amazing bazaars you'll never get tired.We left at 9am and returned at 9 pm .A must see and a great experience.

Historical centre of Istanbul. On a short visit to Istanbul you can pretty much spend the entire time in the Sultanahmet district. Plenty of interesting historical sites to visit plus a huge number of places to eat in and places to stay. The area seems pretty safe, even late at night. The only hassles are from people constantly trying to tout their guide services or to entice you into a carpet store.

Heart and center of Istanbul. It,s top historic place that you can access to most of attraction on foot .Street in historic area is stone base and old when you walk into some area you fell it like old Istanbul.There are so many different transport sytem(boat,tram,metro,car,..)Nice view to bosphorus.There are a lot of restaurant and popular fast food and local food.Good view to Galata tower and galata bridge.Don,t miss it at all
Loved this area. So much history and extremely easy to view everything on foot. Istanbul was beautiful and very clean and people so friendly

Really enjoyed our stay. We loved having 3 days to visit the old part of the city, everything so easily accessible, with interesting sites so close. If you like the historical aspects of culture, this is the place to be.
Amazing Mosque. I really enjoy this place. I have visited few times there. In the early morning, mid noon, afternoon, evening even at mid night. I found beauty of this place at every part of the day.

Heart of Istanbul, A must see place with major attractions in its lap. Sultanahmet district is a must visit place of Istanbul. If you missed Sultanahmet on your visit to Istanbul, then i am all justified to say that you have not visited Istanbul. Sultanahmet is most historic part of Istanbul with major attractions like Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, Sulemania Mosque, Spice Bazar, Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern, Sultanahmet Square are just at walking distance. Unlimited food places with real Turkish flavor are there to entice the visitors. It is always filled with visitors as Markets, tour operators, money changers and one third of hotels in Istanbul are present just at Sultanahmet. This place gives a real flavor of Istanbul, Turkish culture, food and life.
Amazing walk in traditional Turkish culture . Great place to start your Istanbul tour. Lovely streets corridors, boutiques, restaurants. Never miss out on sultanahmet meat balls.
Wonderful . Amazing area when been this area you just feel like a have breath. Spcial little shops are very cute people are helpful of course if you want carpets; ))

everything is here. old world charm, the mosque and the basilica on either side of the road, two stops away on tram (15 mins walking time) from the Grand bazaaar, Sultanahmet is everything about Turkey
Simply great. Very nice and attractive place. With allott of great atmosphere. Very well organised. I really recommend to visit it

It doesn't get much better than this!. What a wonderful place to stay in Istanbul! You should know, though, that this place is for tourists because of the proximity to so many amazing sites. Turks in general don't live here. The attraction is the many sites within walking distance, such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, the Grand Bazaar, The Underground Cistern, just to mention a few. Tons of restaurants to fit any budget.
Shopping time. this are especially the grand bazar is a place for people fan of shopping and walking around, this area is full of restaurants shops and amazing things

amazing and safe. we were told this area would be unsafe to stay but after traveling we found it so nice and safe we walked all the way from taksim square to this area everynight at 2 or 3 am its been safe

Tons of history, monuments, museums, etc. THE MUST in Istanbul. This is where the glorious history of the region began. Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace... We returned to this place over and over again during our stay in the city. My advice? Book a hotel in the district!

Heart of Istanbul. This area was a great place to stay as we had most of the popular sites at our doorstep. We chose the Four Season Hotel in the Sultanhmet area which was next to main leisure area. It was very convenient to visit the top sites of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia. The only issue we faced was that the restaurants in this area were very touristic. We had a very good dinner at Boterra Restaurant which a unique view and close to our hotel. We also found that taking the tram from Sultanmet to Kabatas and walking towards Taksim square was a lovely walking route!
Lovely Old Town. This place can not be expressed by words, it is a must see location. Museums, monuments, mosques, bazaars.. Totally spectacular.

Nice place and safe area to live. Very safe and secure tourist area. Choose a nice hotel.You can walk to all the sightseeing of Istanbul.Take you children for a walk or a jog around the blue mosque early in the morning, when you are awake at 4am with jet lag in the first few days.Local Train are safe. Not sure now. Lots of changes are happening very fast in this part of world in recent past.Police presence is at every nook and corner in this place.

Sultanahmet District. The historical Sultanahmet District is alive and busy. It is worthwhile staying in this area as you will be in walking distance or just a tram ride away from all the main tourist attractions. If you're up for experiencing a traditional Turkish bath visit one of the hamams in the area (allow at least one and a half to two hours).
bit of a pain. . not a lot of tourists this time of year before Christmas, so looking very much from the west we were stocked by everyone the whole time.
Amazing. Ah! One of my most favourite place to be. I wish I could come here over and over again. Having chills down my spine everytime Im there

The Heart of the City. It's a wonderful area to just wander around, taking it all in. So much to see and smell. The prices of the shops are not the cheapest, most if not all things can be bartered. The food places are all authentic and the ones we tried were all providing good food.
Pretty but too many hassles. If you are fair/tall or somehow not Turkish looking (I don't know how the profiling happens) you get hassled constantly.
Old Istanbul - very lovely but tourisitc. Sultanahmet district is the star of Istanbul. No trip is ever completed without visiting Sultanahmet - best of the best ottoman monuments stand tall here!
great. very cultural and historical places. many places to eat the food is wonderful and freshly cooked it is reasonably priced.

A must go for Istanbul. Have always been huge fan of cities' old towns and Sultanahmet definitely did not disappoint! A lot of pretty scenery and medieval surprises to feast my eyes upon during my daily walks around the district.
old Istanbul. the mosques, the streets, the restaurants are all a guide for old city... prices are slightly high but walk around is attractive

Charming district in heart of old Istanbul. I visited and stayed at Sultanahmet district many times, as it is amazing, charming and very romantic part of Istanbul. If you are visiting Istanbul there is not an option not to see this district, besind many coffe shops and great restaurants you will find amazing attractions and a lot of other tourist stuff to do.

Absolutely brethtaking. I was here on a Sunday so there was free admission and there were ongoing noon prayers. Lots of people and loots of good food. Everything is super cheap and the people are super nice.

Everything in walking distance. The Old City is full of incredible historic sights, it is home to a very large number of restaurants and eateries, Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar are in waking distance and it is a safe interesting place to be. If your hotel is located here, you won!
Fantastic historical. Fantastic and nice walkstreets and shops specially you can find there some nice mezza , sweets , souvinier and much more things

Very Beautiful Historical area. I can't express how wonderful area this is, it's where you go back to the Ottman Empire age, by visiting those places mosques grave yards for the late Sultans, breathing the bosphorus air, its like magic.
44 anniversary. Everything is within walking distance especially from Innova Hotel, cafe, fountain, mosque, nice seating area tram stop

Gorgeous!!! History arising.... Golden Horn, Khalkedon, Bosphorus, Grand Bazaar, Byzantium, Konstantinopolis, Ottomans... just a very very few words used to define the amazing ISTANBUL !!! And Sultanahmet is just at the heart of the historical downtown. Many things to do, see, visit, taste, dream, enjoy... at least 5-6 days only for Sultanahmet District. You will want to come again!..

Historic area of Istanbul. You will find so much to see in this district of Istanbul. Very beautiful sites and a great archaeological museum. Take a nice long walk in Gulhan Park. Can't miss the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Museum, the Cisterns, the Grand Bazaar. Take a Turkish Bath (well worth spending the money.) Listen to prayers 5 times per day. It is all magical.

If you have one day in Istanbul, spend it here. A lot of history in a small walkable district. Make sure to visit Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Hippodrome, and the SultanAhmet Kebab House. There are also a few Nargile (hookah) bars in the area that maintain their quaint setting.
Step into History. Sultanahmet District takes you back in time and gives you the aroma of the 17th century Istanbul when it use to be the center of the Great Ottoman Empire.

The location to stay and visit in Istanbul for history buffs. All you'll ever need to know about the classical history of Istanbul is here. The hippodrome, basilica cistern, blue mosque ,grand bazaar and many more are at your doorstep of you stay in this area. Please visit if you get a chance and revel in the history around you
Love it. The best place visited ever :) lot of small shops, restaurants, famous historical buildings, nice places and people. If you can, I suggest to book a hotel in this district, you will love it.

History. My suggestion for this area is to immerse yourself. Stay central in the district and walk everywhere. Read and research so you know what you want to see and go have a great time. We have spent more than 20 days here over a few years and there always new things to experience and learn. Have fun!

Wonderful area to visit - the mosque spectacular. This mosque is not a busy as the Blue Mosque but equally impressive. Outside the mosque there are spectacular views of the Golden Horn and parts of Istanbul. Well worth a visit!

Walk in History. Hagia Sophia, the old Hippodrome (now a pedestrian mall!) and the museums, markets and shops call out for exploration. Wear good shoes. Be ready to hop a tram. Of course the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar, but also the Islamic Art Center, the Mosaic Museum, Carpet Museum and Cisterns. So much !

History in istanbul old city. Shopping , historic sites , restaurants all in short walking distance of each other. This area has a lot if history from the blue mosque to the bastille cistern, Hagi Sophia. You can spend about two days going through all the sites. wonderful sights and must see during your visit.
main touristic area. One of the most important and oldest place of the city. If you come to Istanbul dont go back without seeing this place. try fish in bread here.

Second time in Istanbul. Turkey is my second favorite country.. I love the sites of Istanbul: all close together! Blue Mosque; Hagia Sophia; Topkapi; Cistern; Grand Bazaar (Ugh). Wonderful city and a must to see before you die!

Great place to visit and stay in . I stayed in a hotel but damn, the hostels here are really nice and affordable too. Made a few new friends. The main attractions of Istanbul are just around the corner here or a quick stop from here. They have my favourite restaurant here (near sultanahmet station). Lots of cats and dogs on the streets too if you love animals.

Sultanamet District. This is place to stay as it is within easy walking district to all major sites including Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar, etc. Although it is one of the older parts of Istanbul, there were many nice hotels in the area ranging from high end chains to boutique hotels. There were many restaurants in the immediate area. WE were comfortable walking around at night.

A must see. This area is a must see in Istanbul. It is where the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace are situated. We stayed in the area and definitely made the right choice. Lovely atmosphere with plenty of places to just sit, loads of restaurants and also has a tram stop,

Great place to stay when in Istanbul . My first time travelling to Istanbul I stayed in the Sultanahmet district and I couldn't of made a better choice. I loved it! It's close to al tourist attractions, restaurants and the metro. If this is your first time visiting Istanbul this is a great place to stay. There are many beautiful hotels in this area.

So much to see, so much to do. This is the heart of Nova Roma and all that followed. There is Constantine's column, the Hippodrome, the Blue Mosque...the list goes on. The streets are replete with restaurants catering to English-spkeaing tourists. Shopping is unavoidable. Don't even try. There is the Turkish delight - the food in the shop windows.

Prime locality for tourists.. Sultanahmet is a prime locality for any tourist in Istanbul. This area has all the important attractions like AyaSofya, Blue Mosque, Taksim Square, Grand Bazaar, Basilica Cisterns, etc. The trams are very helpful means of transportation across this area.

I love Istanbul. This is a wonderful area to visit, the sounds, the smells, the people, what an explosion to the senses. Spent 6 weeks in and around Istanbul and loved every minute of it. So much history, fantastic. I travelled in 2014

Lovely. We had a lovely hour roaming around the Hippodtome. Lots of places to sit and wonder at the beauty of this area. It's right next to the Blue Mosque. If the weather is dry I recommend spending a bit of time out of your visit to Istanbul to imagine how it would have been with the horses racing round the circuit and everyone cheering them on. Very atmospheric.

perfect view. it a place to visit that had got perfect view, lots of food courts with delicious food like kumpir and lemonade and you can find handcrafts here. and enjoy looking at the sea, it is very good place to eat kumpir here.

Best Area to Stay in Istanbul. Perfect area to stay in in Instabul - Heart of the Old Town - major Istanbul attractions - close to everything. As I travel alone, the entire area was clean and safe. I stayed at the Deluxe Golden Horn and that too was in the heart of everything.
A must while visiting Istanbul. Easily accessible due to excellent puplic tansport system in Turkey. If you are visiting for the first time I would suggest to look for the hotel in this district.

Mid Week Break. We stayed very close to this area as it is full of very nice small family run hotels and most of the sites and attractions are within easy walking distance. The area bustles with tourists and locals who are going about their business the atmosphere is very friendly and everyone is so helpful. Public transport from this area is by tram or the Big Red Bus Tour, which I would recommend highly as you get to see Istanbul first hand via the red route and blue route. You can hop off and on in any 24 hour period with your ticket. If you venture off into the side streets you will see the most fascinating sites for example one street was full of shoe shops. These shops were not really for retail but just to show what is on offer to the trade and boxes upon boxes are being packed in the street for distribution all of Turkey and the World. It is total organised chaos and a site to see and observe real hard work as carts are pulled up and down steep hills by all ages of men and boys. Great atmosphere

Shops and eateries galore. This is the area where the enormous ancient Pazar Is located.you can walk from the main square or get an overpriced taxi. This is THE tourist district. Be prepared. This is Istanbul as is written in all the guide books. Bring cash to haggle. Cash is king. If you are staying in this district, then you can walk everywhere but if you are in Pera, it will take a good 20 minutes in a costly taxi and more to get out of the tourist trap!
Incredible. Well, if seeing incredible mosques, eating great food, and shopping in bizarres isn't enough don't go to Istanbul! Beautiful area, very clean and safe!
Crazy, fabulous city. Has to be seen to be believed. Vibrant,dynamic place. Felt safe and inspired by the friendliness of the people.
had the after noon prayer.... my only claim is that, the entrance/exit system too complicated!..the interior clean, fresh and more than impressive.

The Center of Istanbul!. Sultanahmet is the most touristy place in Istanbul cause u got all the main attractions there, so dont wonder if u dont find any non touristy restaurants or shops. but anyway, its a very nice neighbourhood and with the blue mosque and the hagia sophia facing eachother is a great experience and ull an aw moment!

Sultan Ahmed Square and Mosque . Whilst walking through the square there is a German Fountain, Egyptian Obelisk and Serpentine Column. It worth taking one of the headsets you can hire to hear the history of all the above. The Blue Mosque is beautiful with its high ceiling and blue tiles, but do respect that people still use for praying and they do close from 1 30 to 3 pm daily for prays. Again it's important to have either a guide or headset to have an understanding of the history.
Beautiful . Absolutely beautiful right by the metro I'm eminunu right out of the pazar everything within view the sea just a beautiful city
So much history!. There is so much to see within this district. So much history and culture. We practically lived in this area!

Visiting Istanbul, living in Sultanahmet district. Maybe this review would be helpful for someoneIf you plan to stay couple of days in Istanbul (as a tourist of course), please consider booking a hotel directly in Sultanahmet District. It has hundreds of good options. I managed to book a great double room for 50$ in Burchin hotel.Why is booking a room in this district is vital:1) all sightseeings are within 10 min walk2) train / metro are very lose (no need to use expensive taxi)3) You can always come back to your room and have a 30 minutes restAlso, consider buying a "city card" - it allows using public transport almost twice cheaper and not buying "coins" for every sing;e shipment.Always check the prices and always ask for bill.btw. A lot of hotels in this area has a restaurants on upper floor, so your morning coffee view shall be rewarded by amazing lookPS don't buy an "apple tea" which is sold as white powder (it has nothing to do with tea)
Very nice place, the heart of Istanbul!. Very interesting visit. If you go there in summer you need to have appropriate clothes to enter the mosque

Wonderful walking tour area. I have toured this area 8 times as a group leader - with an English speaking guide. I learn new things EVERY time that I do this tour. Istanbul is my favorite city and this area is my favorite area. Not to be missed!
Best place in istanbul. A place that you must visit at istanbul by its shops, souvenirs, restaurants. You can find everything here.

Fascinating City.. Istanbul's old area of Sultanahmet is an incredibly fascinating part of city.All the major sites are found in this area such as the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia,the Basilica Cisterns,Topkapi Palace, the Archaeological Museum, theGrand Bazaar, the Whirling Dervishes and the delicious freshly pressed pomegranate juice. Also a myriad of interesting shops and restaurants. Accommodation is ample and often with a traditional flavor. Don't stay in the new city, mostly everything you will want to see is in this old area and the tram system runs right the middle of it.

Excellent Tourist district. This area has many tourists attractions of Istanbul; Hagia Sofia,Grand Bazaar, Sultanahmet mosque, Basilica Cistern, Obelisk and Bosphorus river meet here; Maramara sea is visible from a long distance. It is situated onear 2-3 tarms stops. Beautiful Bosphorus river is also visible. Many shops and restaurant are there around this attraction. Grand bazaar is a good shopping place: for purchasing cheap local things, good souvenirs.All need to walk for hours to see all the attractions .This place is very near to city center; it is very very easy to go by public bus or by tram. From airport taxi is the bets transport though a bit expensive, better to take taxi then change it at a metro station and then tram.

A Full Day. You will want to spend a full day here as all of the major sites are in a small area and you can easily leave one to go to another. We started at the Hipodrome and went on to the German fountain (fascinating) before heading to Tokapi Palace. After lunch we toured the Hagia Sofia (Ayasofia) and Blue Mosque before heading out to the Grand Bazaar. Lucky with great weather to make it easy to see so much in one short day!

Walk thru History. Sultanahmet District you can not miss it when you visit Istanbul , you basically walk thru the history of the City and the region with different cultures .... you also meet people from east , west , north and south.

Come here for the sights and history, not the restaurants or shopping. The neighborhood is home to some of the most popular attractions, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The surrounding vendors and restaurants take advantage of that and you'll find mediocre food 2-3 times the price as other neighborhoods. Kumpir for example is 27 lira near the Blue Mosque and 12 Lira on Istiklal in Taxim. Pomegranate Juice same story, plate of Doner 31 lira, 15-18 in Taxim. Its not just price though, its lack of quality.
Fantastic . What a great treasure trove of a place to stay in. This is the original and old part of Istanbul - and is Istanbul itself. Everything else is an add on.

The essence of Istanbul. This is the heart of the historic Istanbul and you are pleasantly surprised at every turn and cornerThere is so much to do and seeSo many lovely little shops with beautiful Turkish handicraft So many appetizing and appealing stalls and restaurants to choose fromAnd not to forget the very turkish teahouses where you can taste the baklava and sweets

Taxis from Sultanahmet to your Hotel. Be aware of taxis from the Sultanahmet district. They are giving you the extra tour, as well as it happens that the taxameter can be jacked and the worst part that they are trying to swap the notes you give them. Like the fare is 80TL, you give them 100TL and they turn back to you and showing you a 20TL note, saying you gave wrong note.This happened now the third time to me and the only way this will stop is when as many people as possible are aware about it and not taking taxis from there.Same is valid from the Taksim plaza.
Amazing lovely place . We have been many times with all my friends and then also very good location people were very friendly as always say that you have to visit here

All of the major historic sites are in this district.. The blue mosque, the hippodrome, the Hagia Sophia and the Topkopi Palace are all here. The great thing is they are all within walking distance and interwoven with gift shops and restaurants. Very easy to navigate.
best place to stay. Best place to stay if you want to visit the historic part of the city. Within walking distance from most attraction, Sultanahmet has its own charm.
A great area to stay in Istanbul. This is a great area to stay in Istanbul, because it is so close to many popular tourism sites. There are many options of places to stay in Sultanahmet.

The spirit of Istanbul. You would need a significant time here to feel the overwhelming aura of this area. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topakapi Palace, Basilica Cistern...this place just keeps getting better. Really good Hamam places around and a great food lovers area too.

You will travel back in history. The area is so rich in historical monuments, shops, attractions, and nice eateries. If ever in Istanbul you should stroll down the alleys and streets of the district. Lots of shopping for all budgets.
Great place to stay in Istanbul. Sultanahmeth comes at European side of Istanbul and covers major attractions. Its the best place for food lovers

Edges (History, Commerce, Lacunae). The further afield you go, uphill, away, the better. Get lost. Wander. But even the centre... the hippodrome... there was a massacre here, a riot, where 70,000 people died. Only in Istanbul (knot Constantinople) do 70,000 souls get wiped out AND IT DOESN'T EVEN WARRANT A PLAQUE! Well, okay, not only in Istanbul (the Military Museum here, and in any country really, has some blind spots the size of the Blue Mosque). But. It's something.

THE place to stay in Istanbul. If you want to see the sights by foot, then this is the place to stay. There are so many hotels around here so you should never be more than 10 minutes away from the main Sultanahmet area.Public transport is probably the easiest way to get here. If you arrive at Ataturk, most of the hotels provide a free transfer. If you arrive at Sabiha Gokcen, then you can catch the Havatas coach to Taksim, then catch the funicular to Karakoy. After this, catch the metro to Sultanahmet. Buy the Istanbulkart (like the Oyster Card in London) which gives you cheaper rates on public transport and one card can be used by many people.Once you've arrived, you can just walk around everywhere for the top sites - Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia etc. (Buy the Museum Pass if you plan to see a few sites, will save a lot of time and money.)There are lots of free places to go including the Blue Mosque, University Art Museum, Topkapi palace grave monuments - many others are not too far by public transport (e.g. Gulhane Park)The only issue is there is not much good authentic food in this area. There are plenty of kebab shops and fast food restaurants including Burger King and McDonalds. Prices here for food are slightly higher than other areas - especially the Asian side of Istanbul (here the food is delicious and very cheap!).

The place to be in Istanbul!. After a lot of debate, we chose to pick a hotel in Sultanahmet district or the Old City. If you are a traveller who like to visits the city and experience the local life, look no further.. It can be shock on your first day. Motor traffic, Tram, metro all cutting through the streets.. Total chaos but you'll learn to love it for that's Istanbul for you.Word of warning, do not take the taxi for one its a rip off, two they never get to exactly where you want to be, it's always around the corner and thirdly the Turks like a good deal so if you are a couple expect them to stop and pick up another person to make an extra bit of cash and for that you'll have the pleasure of seeing place you did not intend to nor will you get there in time!So simply put use the public transport. It's well connected and very frequent and seemingly on time.. You have access you ferry Tram metro and marmaray lines all in Sultanahmet. All your sights are here.. So it is a good choice no doubt.Get the Istanbul Kart just like the Londons Oyster Card load up and it's the most economical way to travel in Istanbul and in my experience the efficient way too. We love the local transport so.much we even went back to the Ataturk airport by metro, close to 30-35 mins from Old City.Hope you found this useful.
Excellent. Excellent historical place in Istanbul.Eerybody have to see this history.We enjoyed so much and will come again for a long time
SUPER SULTANAHAMET. Brilliant area, lots to see, lots of choice of restaurants and things to see, very near Grand Bazaar and transport links to everywhere.

A must visit in Istanbul. Beautiful architecture, great ambiance and where all the main attractions are located, its a must visit for anyone visiting Istanbul. The only downside is that some of the restaurant owners are very pushy in trying to get you into their establishments.

Beautiful historic old city. Visited the Sultanahmet Square, Topkapi Place, Sophia Hagia, Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque on a day tour. Pls visit Gulhane Park absolutely beautiful, stunning gardens. Always do the Hop on Hop off bus tour!! Visit Asia whilst in Turkey!!!
Just walking, is outstanding. Sultanahmet district is a very nice place, you can walk, sit in a restaurant or visit any of the surrounding mosques or museums

Stay in this district. We are staying here for 6 days and haven't taken a taxi anywhere. We have walked to the Grand Bazaar, turkish bath, Cisterns, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Spice Market, Galata Bridge, and the palace. Love waking up to the sound of call to prayer.

Jewels of architecture. Wonderful city, it is a delight for all your senses. Local people in Istambul are customer oriented and they really want to please you!Loved this city, and hope I can come back in the near future!

Jam-packed with landmarks. The hippodrome, the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and a whole array of museums all within walking distance from one another - and not far from the spice bazaar and Galata Bridge. This district deserves several days of exploration.

Heart of the shopping area and close to monuments.. Very conveniently located close to several shops and restaurants and within walking distance of monuments such as the Hagia Sophia, Blue mosque and Topkapi Palace and not too far from the airport. You can walk mos of the time to several interesting places. Good locations to stay at.

Great. So much history here. It's amazing. Sultanahmet is a great area to base yourself out of, as most of the major attractions are withing walking distance, and everything else is just a short train ride away.

Chora travel - tour guide - Metin. We had Chora Travel plan our holiday and our tour guide - Metin was this very energetic and enthusiastic guide who went out of his way to let us the Istanbul that he loves including a culinary tour of file of his best loved places to eat!
Amazing Metin!!

Best place to stay for a short visit. We stayed in the old town/Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. We were a three minute walk to the tram line. The first tram stop up the hill is the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, and Basilica Cisterns (easy walk). We are usually adventuresome and like the challenge of public transportation ( I think it is a direct tram ride) but this time with the rain we took the shuttle. Orientation is a challengers the old city, as streets twist and turn and start and stop. Our hotel gave us a good map and a card to carry if we should become lost. You simply give it to the taxi driver and they will bring you home (good idea but we did not need it). The view from our hotel room looked out on the old Topkapi castle wall (50 m away) and the back of the Hagia Sophia. We stayed at the Yasmak Sultan hotel (clientele are international). There are a variety of shops and restaurants within a few minutes walk. At first we were hesitant to wander around the streets after dark but soon found the neighborhood was quite safe. This is not the trendy bar scene so it quiets down by nine or ten. We were worried about travel with an almost two year old but soon learned that the Turkish people see children as gifts from God. Even as we walked down the street men and women both would smile and wave and want to touch our grandson's head or hand. It was heartwarming to experience.

Walk around the Sultanahmet District to see the highlights of Istanbul. The Sultanahmet District is a great place to start any visit of Istanbul. Many of the main tourist attractions are within walking distance

The Ultimate in Byzantine History. Overwhelming in scale, with masses of people-natives as well as tourists. The sounds from the mosques, the traffic and the number of places for eating, snacking and shopping are never ending.

Historical Old City. This district forms the old city area of Istanbul. It has a lot of old building some dating 200-300 years. A lot many of the old mansion shave been converted into small boutique hotels. This area has small narrow roads and bylanes. Its a very nice part of Istanbul. I stayed here during my visit. All the major historical monuments like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern are situated here. There is a tram staion. It is an excellent location and well connected. Lots of eateries selling traditional Turkish food and sweets are found here.
Vibrant City..... History of a kingdom and culture. Its amazing ..worth to watch .Clean and beautiful area. Tourist friendly.

lively and vibrant. most beautiful place in istanbul, you can see the most historical places and museums, full of life and hotels, close by tram and bus station, full of restaurant and cafes. it's the best place to stay in istanbul

Great Sights, Bad Salesmen. The area is one of the most historically significant in the world. Ancient Rome, the Byzantine era, and the Ottoman era are all on display. However, outside these photogenic landmarks is a den of carpet salesmen armed with all their charm trying to bring you into their shop. They are impressive in their own right—they all speak at least 5 languages fluently. They mean you no harm, so just give them a firm no if you're not interested. Some of them may still chat with you even if they know you aren't buying. Enjoy their company!

World History at your doorstep!. We stayed in this area and were glad we did, since all major historical attractions are just minutes away. Easy to walk everywhere. No nightlife - if you want that, stay near Taskim Square since the clubs don't start until very, very late and there is no night time public transportation - only taxi. Sultanahmet is very 'touristy' - but if you go off the main streets you'll find small local restaurants and shops.

One day in Istanbul is all you need to experience the city. All you need is one day and all you need to see is in the Sultanahmet District. If you have additional days, plan day tours to other places in and around.

Amazing amazing amazing. Definitely the heart of Istanbul and a MUST-SEE if you're visiting the city. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace are all in this area. Nice restaurants to dine in as well (though I cant remember any specific ones). There is an ice cream cart set up near the entrance of Hagia Sophia which sells the most phenomenal Turkish ice cream. It was so good I had it thrice in three days, even though one of the days was particularly chilly. Love Istanbul, it truly is one of my most favourite cities in the world.
The best part of Istanbul. The area of old city of Istanbul is the spirit of this ancient city. I strongly recommend, staying in hotels there and try traditional food in this area.

Whole lot of things to do and see in this place. There are so many things to do and see in this area that you will need more than a couple of days to do everything. Dont miss anything. Its safe to go around even at night.
Wonderful walking. Take some time to stroll around the Sultanahmet District as you head towards the Grand Bazaar. Takes some time to go off the main streets and visit a cafe or shop.

A must visit. The number one area to visit in Istanbul with the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the Grand Bazaar and the Basilica as well as the Topkapi Palace all within a few minutes walk of each other. Beware of the extremely persistent touts who could become verbal abusive and remember that like any similar area with major tourist attractions in other major cities throughout the world the prices of everything are in flattered.

The heart of Istanbul. This place has everything that makes Istanbul amazing - beautiful mosques and other sites, the colorful bazaars, loads of restaurants. It's a treat for your senses. Just beware of pickpockets, sellers haggling for your business, and cab drivers who try to trick you.
Breathtak,ing. You will be amazed at the sheer scale of this remarkable building, it is not for a five minute jaunt but take your time it is architecture at its very best.

Beautiful Istanbul. Sultanamet district is very vibrant with many mosque and many attractions around walking distance.. aya sofia, blue mosque, grans bazzar everything is close.. it's pretty much covers the must see places if you are there fro a short trip..

In the center of history. We stayed in Sultanahment for 6 days November 2015. The area is full of impressive sights: Topkapi palace, Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the grand bazaar, the spice bazaar, and many small shops and restaurants in the cobbled streets. The only downside is the aggressive way many shop owners and waiters try to get you into their shops/restaurants
a MUST VISIT place. If you are in Istanbul, you must go to the Basilica. You will be impressed how big it is and how many things you can see.

Nicely place . Its a place you must to go if you are in Istanbul there is sultana ahmet historical masjid and aya Sofia historical masjid and many places to sets and eat or drink very nice and suitable for families to spend at least 2 days there are many coffee to smoke shesha with many different tastes

The Heart of Istanbul. This is the best area to base yourself in when travelling to Istanbul. There are lots of tourist attractions close by such as the Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cistern, plenty of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance, and when we visited in November, it was a quiet area of the city and it felt safe to walk around at night, unlike the much more crowded areas on the other side of the river. There are plenty of open spaces to enjoy such as Sultanahmet Square and the park where the Topkapi Palace is situated. I would definitely stay in this district again over any other district in the city.

A day well spent!. Everything from shopping to lovely walks to great food dot this area. You are completely spoilt for choice if you have limited time here. You can spend more than a couple of days here and still have plenty to doA must visit while in Istanbul!
Where to stay. We were told by friends to stay in Sultanahmet and though we have not been here 24 hours yet we are not disappointed.

A delightful surprise. Clean, safe and all the key sites of Istanbul in strolling distance.. The area known as Sultanahmet is surrounded by the two great historic religious builings, the Blue Mosque and perhaps the oldest church in christendom, Aghia Sophia.The former hippodrome or Roman circus or horse race course is a pleasant stroll and the whole area is clean a welcoming. Do stop in the cafe in front of the Turkish bath house for an ice cream or a delicious coffee and cakes.
Amazing. This is my forth time to Istanbul and my forth time to stay in a hotel there. Restaurants are amazing and the attractions? Oh my God amazingThe sultan Ahmet mosque? Wonderful

Pray enjoy its yard. This mosque is so relaxing plac..nd do not worry if u do not have a praying clothes as u will get from there a skirt and hijab..so big and tidy place and thanks for those who work there..thay give a prefect image of islam

Grand area!. If you must visit only one area in Istanbul, then get on a cab or get on the tram and make your way to Sultanahmet. The sights are incredible and the food that one get’s in this locality is incredible. Avoid the tourist trap restaurants, and make your way for some of the amazing Kumpir that is sold in the area. You can spend time at the majestic Topkapi Palace, incredible Hagia Sophia, fantastic Blue Mosque, glorious Gulhane Park and the incredible Bascilica Cistern. My advice would be to get in here early in the morning and enjoy the historical places without the long queues.

Cultural Historical Heart and Soul of Istanbul. Your very first decision when planning a trip to Istanbul is whether to stay in the Sultanahmet district or elsewhere. Initially, we stayed just outside of the district within easy tram commute. If I were to return soon, I might consider stating in a bit closer just to be able to walk everywhere. The Sultanahmet area will simply swallow you up as it simply where you will end up over and over again depending on your specific destination. Embrace the hustle and bustle and just take it all in. This is where you just walk and walk until you can walk no more!

Stunning!!. My favorite part of Istanbul. All of the main attractions (Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome) are within walking distance of one another, flanking a plaza with a pretty fountain in the middle. You could easily spend a whole day here!

Best place to stay. Staying in Sultanahmet is the best thing to do in Istanbul. Easy reach of all the landmarks, quick connectivity to the rest of Istanbul and quick access to all the sights assure you that you will enjoy this heritage district as much as I did. I spent eight days here and explored Istanbul well to be reassured of easy and economical means back to the room

Past lives here. SultanAhmet District is full of history, dotted with many monuments, hotels, restaurants, to name a few (Hagia Sophia Mosque/ Blue Mosque/ Basilica Cistern). Access from Sultanahmet tram stn.

Walk around this neighborhood. Rich in history. Stay in this District. Walk around this district day or night. Lots to see and lots of restaurants also. There is a tram to other Istanbul neighborhoods that runs through this Distric.

Endless Delights. With easy access by tram, the Sultanahmet District is a must-see in Istanbul. Even if you don't go to museums like the Hagia Sophia or the Basilica Cistern, there are countless shops to explore and restaurants at every turn where you can enjoy a çay, a Turkish coffee, a cold drink, or some typical Turkish cuisine. On a clear day or evening, don't miss one of the numerous restaurants with great views from their roof-top terraces. Be sure to check out the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar–and don't forget to get some delicious Turkish delight while you shop...
Fascinating ancient area of Istanbul. Loved this old world atmosphere. Despite a multitude of tourists it retains a captivating aura. Constant feast of ever-changing street scenes.
Historic District. Sultanahmet Distric encompasses all interesting historical monuments and Bazars. Staying in this district does not require any transport to visit sites.

The prime area to visit in Istanbul.. Historic buildings, neat bazaars, quaint hotels, numerous restaurants, cobblestone streets, and the central tourist hub. Great area to stroll and soak up some culture as well as sample some traditional food and drinks.
Sultanahmet District. Interesting zone for turism. It's interesting to find coffe shops / Restaurants with nice terraces one the last floor which offers a great view over the city and sea.

Best area in Istanbul . It's best place to be near every thing almost:
Sultan Ahmet mosque (blue mosque)
Hagia Sophia
Topkapi palace
Golhane park
Basilica Cistern
Hagia Irene
And many wonderful places in Istanbul

Cover pretty much tourist sites in Istanbul.. When you get off from the tram out to this station, you can walk to most of the top tourist attractions in Istanbul, Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, Basilica Cistern, the Castle or the Mosaic museum, etc., It's the walking distance from this station cover pretty much everything in this area. Good restaurants, market and so on.

Hub of Historic Pennisula. You can easily spend 2 days or more just walking around this area. Many points of interest beyond its boundaries are easily accessible by the tram than runs through the area.

The old city of Istanbul. Surrounded by the city wall. The most prominent and must visit place will be Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Sultanahmet Mosque (better known as Blue Mosque). The whole enclave has many historical trail from Romans, Ottoman and Greek.Browse through the wall of Topkapi Palace. The ceramic tiles are unique. There are a few spots and cafetaria where you can sit and enjoy the view of Bosphorus Straits and Sea of Marmara where ships sail through. You can also walkabout the square and go Grand Bazaar which sells a lot of souvenirs and local delicacies. There are about 2000 stores in the Grand Bazaar and you may lost yourself in there as there are a lot of entrances/ gates.

Has a little bit of everything and great friendly people willing to give good prices for grat services.. Safe, near to very historical sites and great people. I would come back every time I visited here. Loved it!

Lots to see in this wonderful old part of the city. If you come to Istanbul for sightseeing you will end up (or possibly stay) in the Sultanahmet district. This is the old part of the city and here you will find Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar and other wonderful things.There is a tram which is easily used albeit crowded.
