history at your fingertips. everything you need in a small area haghia Sophia-topkapi palace-blue mosque-basilica cistern-archeological museum-hipperdrome all within walking distance plus restaurants also the tram stop to visit any place in istanbul

Where The Major Sights are Located. Sultanahmet is of course perfect for sightseeing in Istanbul. Located here are the most attractions: Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar. They are close to one another and within walking distance. Therefore, I would recommend anyone visiting Istanbul to stay in this area.

Don't miss it! Many of the main attractions are here.. Lots to see and do! There is the Blue Mosque, the Higa Sophia, the Cisterns, the Top Kopi Palace as well as the Arasta Bazaar with a nice little open air restaurant featuring a whirling dervish that performs for free every night around 8 or 9 p.m.

Old Town Istanbul. wander the narrow streets amongst the crowds and experience the old town. pretty much all the top attractions are here except the Galata tower and the Dolmabache palace. Very easily navigable and easily walked around in about two days. We took five deliberately as we don't really enjoy more than one museum a day.Absolute musts are the spice market, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, and the Galata bridge. The sultanahmet mosque is also impressive. We were least impressed by the grand bazaar especially for shopping. the building is impressive but it is full of tat at high prices. Where you find quality, you may also find it very overpriced
Lively place to visit. What an interesting and lively place to walk around. Some of the vendors do get a little aggravating trying to pull you into their establishements
A must-see in Istanbul!. It would be the best place to stay in during your holiday in Istanbul. Sultanahmet District is where the most Istanbul's attractions located.
an Old touch of the East. it is a must visit during your stay in Istanbul. worth every step of walking. try local food in the area and don't miss the Turkish ice cream.

Sultanahmet is great, but there is so much more.. Start your vacation in Istanbul here. Visit the Hagia Sophia ( buy a ticket from a near buy vending machine and jump the queues - same price). Once that's done, visit the Blue Mosque (free), then the palace ( don't forget the harem even though it is a little extra), and finally visit the subterranean cisterns, all four are within a 1/4 mile of each other and well worth a visit. If you look lost for more than 1 minute someone will offer to help you: he is a carpet salesman - I guarantee it. ( Don't buy a carpet for more than, say, $200, unless you know what you are buying. Counting the stitches on the back isn't all there is to it.)Now your real exploration of Istanbul can begin! Dive down side streets, into tiny shops and go where the Turkish people go. Check out the spice (aka Egyptian) market. It is much much smaller than the Grand Bazaar, and the streets south of it a treat you will not forget. Learn how to use the trams, which is easy, and spend some time getting lost. Finally, choose a budget price hotel, again down a back street, and meet the people who don't arrive in mega air conditioned coaches.

Great place for food & fashion & see young locals. Lots of restaurants, cafes, fashion boutiques. Was there for 3 times but still couldn't have the chance to hop on the free old tram. Its just always fully pack with ppl. I was a bit surprise with the local fashion brand pricing, its more expensive than the US brand and Europe brand. Nevertheless, they are good design and quality.

Convenient district to stay to explore the history of Istanbul.. Great district to stay for the history knowledge seeking tourist - walking distance to most of the noticeable place in the Istanbul. Very beautiful and authentic streets and the environment.

Stunning concentration of interests. I can't remember when in all my travels (60 countries) I have found such a concentration of historical buildings, shops and restaurants in one place. It would be a serious mistake to rent a hotel room in some well-known hotel chain far-removed from Sultanahmet.

Excllent location. If you want to be on the heart of everything, this is the place to be. Walking distance to all attractions. Easy metro access. Avoid using taxis, they are cranky and crooked like a barrel of snakes! So many options for eating drinking shopping and sightseeing yet very reasonable prices. Sure it's a little higher than local spots, but very accessible for the average tourist.
Great for wandering . . .. Loved walking around in this area. Lots of interesting shops, sights and aromas from all the fabulous spices. Wander and see where each street takes you.

A Must-See in Istanbul. Great stores, restaurants and historic and religious attractions. The people are so friendly and helpful. The main street leading to the historic attractions is so quaint with interesting shops and restaurants.

Stay here - no brainer. We stayed at the Tan hotel in Sultamahmet, very happy with both. Handy to everything. Lots of food options, and has a great feel. Word of advice, always check prices before commiting. Pic from hotel dining terrace.

Istanbul - Won't Disappoint!. We ended a transatlantic/ Mediterranean cruise with 4 nights in Istanbul. It was truly the highlight of the entire trip. Not knowing what to expect or how we would get around we stayed in the heart of the tourist district a few blocks from the Blue Mosque. Easy walk to Hajia Sofia and the Hippodrome, shops and restaurants. Easy Bus ride to Grand Bazarre and Bosphorus Cruises. The people of Istanbul were friendly and helpful to tourists. We felt very safe day or night. The food was delicious. And don't forget to buy a rug! Haha. We will definitely go back.

Exciting. What an experience. So long as you can stand the amount of people crammed into this marketplace. I highly recommend visiting. Careful there are many stores selling the same items, so don't buy the first thing you see. Use your bartering skills and you are sure to exit with a great bargain.

Exciting. The centre of the old town in Istanbul, easily accessed by the tram ( very easy to use public transport system ). Always lots of people from all over the world, not too many people trying to sell guide books this time, you will always meet someone who's uncle sells carpets, if you want one that's fine go to their shop, if not just smile and no " no Thankyou I don't need a carpet ". Always something happening in this area, lots of street food to try.

Too much to see! . A looooooot of food and things to see. I guess it's better to buy stuff here than in grand bazaar but just for the sake of visiting grand bazaar, just go and check it out. This place reminds me of kadikoy!

The heart of old Istanbul. This is the best part of the city. Just about everything you want to see in Istanbul is close to or in Sultanahmet. The Haghia Sofia, the Blue mosque, Topkapi, the Hippodrome, the Basilica Cistern....While choosing a hotel to stay, my priority was not luxury. I wanted a good or decent hotel in a convenient, scenic place. I found it in Sultanahmet. The hotel was walking distance from most attractions in Istanbul. It was a decent hotel with a terrace restaurant from where on one side you could see Haghia Sofia and the Blue mosque and on the other side the Sea of Marmara and the entrance to the Bosphorus.Sultanahmet is the place to pick your hotel.

Nice historic area. A lovely vibrant part of the city. Very historic. Great hotels. Nice shops.tree lined streets. Try the turkish delight (lokum) in the shops of which thete are many devoted to it. Pomegranate and pistachio lokum...delicious!
Colorful, also the spices.. This is a very colorful district that was accessible via tram from our hotel. We loved the market with the spices and other goodies.
In the heart of Istanbul. Located in the heart of the old city, everything happens here, shopping, eating for all to enjoy.Excellent transport system to.

A place for Bargain hunters. For Bargain hunters. the area provided ample opportunities to bargain for. The Spice Market - is another nice place to visit during the day. DryFruits, juices, are all available at reasonable price.
Where Everything is Happening. Make sure your hotel is in this district. You want to be able to walk to everything. Our hotel, The World Heritage, was exceptional.
Great neighborhood. Walking distance for mosques etc. Lots of small hotels and restaurants near. Bazar also nearby below Blue Mosque.

Busy with Tourists. Most tourists probably staying somewhere in or near this area. Lots of shops, eating places, money changers, etc. Beware of scams luring around the square and the market. Just smile and keep walking, its a bit intimidating at first but generally safe when you ignore them. Most people heading to Grand Bazaar or the Blue Mosque/Hagia Sophia/Topkapi which are all within walking distance in this area. Or if you tired, you can always take the efficient tram.

The Great Place. I think I am not able to praise about this part of Istanbul. A nice place of variety of hotels. You can enjoy staying here as little as $35 a night,including Buffet Breakfast.Information Agents, WOW, the are very very friendly. They are able to suggest you according to your Budget.Thanks to Tourism Department of Turkish Government, for their training.I still remember those moments in that area, Hoping to visit again.

A maze of streets that have everything Istanbul can offer.. Choice of hotel is a must. This city requires a lot of walking. It can be exhausting because of the hills and heat. I stayed in a very noisy area and had to wear noise canceling earplugs in order to sleep, but within one block it was very quiet. Restaurants are everywhere and the food is good and reasonably priced.

Amazing place.. So lively, picturesque and historic. So what if it is full of tourists and touts? That's what you're here for! Watch your wallet, smile and thank the touts, and keep walking. Bargain!! Check Tripadvisor when you decide on a restaurant; it saved us some unpleasant surprises.
Good shopping place. It was a great place for shopping for my family. Son had a great time shopping for his college. Also great place for Turkish delights. Lots of bargaining

exotic. Arrived in Istanbul for a trade show and took a day off to do some sightseeing, the grand bazaar was as exotic as it was fun to shop in with many goods availableThe Blue mosque was beautiful and the sidewalk tea houses were plentifulDinner on the waterfront was an experience I will always remember

walking distance from hotel. There are so many sites to see in the Sultanahmet District! We stayed at the Basileus Hotel and everything was walking distance from there. So many things to see and do. The food everywhere was also amazing. You can't go wrong no matter what you choose.

Walk around....explore...you'll be amazed. Walking the streets and poking into the stores we found awesome baklava and other turkish delights. The best are from the fresh stores, and don't buy boxed (not at the airport, so much more expensive). Wander the back streets and alleys, and you will find stores, shopkeepers and lovely restos.

Best place to stay. Best place to stay, all attractions are in this part of town and very close to each other. Perfect for a tourist to discover all of this on foot . There are plenty of tram stops also near by.Sultanahmet district is bustling with tourists, restaurants and cafes .Lots of street vendors around too, to grab a quick bite.Sovienier shops are also there.Perfect place to stay with little children.
Must see. The best happening place of Istanbul. Full of action and tourists. Great to eat local food and very clean.
Great architecture, well preserved. Clean and well preserved, the buildings were easily reached by foot. When required, provides free garments to meet clothing standard
the old city - have to see it. this is an experience! people is nice, clean, thousands of people and you never feel intimidated, foreign, or out of place. Turkish people is soo nice....

Interesting area for everyone. Went with a private guide - walking tour - this was the best way to see & experience it all - would miss out on a lot of places if not with a local - this area has something for everyone - must go - Istanbul has so much to offer - need more than 1 day to experience it all !

Find also Your hotel here. Sultanahmet area includes the most important sights of Istanbul. At the same time it is the area where sultans lived and spet their time. Topkapi Mosquei and horseraces were here. Today area is well equpped for turists with nice restaurants and shops.Also Grat Bazaar is in easy walking distance. Best place to find hotel for turist visits in Istanbul.
people. This place is just packed with people as the pic is of the bazaar, 100's of shops but all selling the same thing, but a good spot to people watch and have a beer or a coffee!!

Buzzing tourist place. If you are visiting Istanbul, you possibly will be spending most of your time here. This district is full of museums, mosques, restaurants, hotels, monuments, cafes, street food carts, parks, ottoman palaces and so many other attractions. Important points to note: 1) You have to walk in most streets as this area does not allow cars to be driven on the roads close to attractions. In some streets you may be able to use the tram.2) Some roads are hilly so prepare your footwear as required. For elderly people, allow enough time for moving.3) Be aware of hawkers, tea sellers and salesmen trying to pull you into their shops.

Sultanahmet District. Good choice of shops and restaurants. The Arasta Bazar is in my opinion a more enjoyable shopping experience. Not overly acosted by owners unlike Grand Bazar where you are almost pounced upon once one stoos to look. Just seems very relaxed and great. Great historic sites and reasonable prices. Some are a bit expensive the closer to Topkapi Palace.
Wonderful area to stay in. Brilliant area, good shopping, good restaurants and friendly people. Perfect location for sightseeing - Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia within walking distance.

The quieter part of town.. We actually stayed in this area and found it as respite from the hussle and bussle of a very large city. Contains some key attractions and has some beautiful parts down by the waters edge.

Old City. Not only a beautiful place because of the amazing monuments but also because you can find anything you want. Walk around the area and you can find restaurants with great views, bazaars to do your shopping, patisseries with tasteful turkish desserts and many more. A place that you can not exclude from your trip.

great place to enjoy people and sightseeing. this place could be considered the hub of the tourist sites. all of them are grouped here,the blue mosque,the hippodrome,aya sofya and a bit farther, Topkapi Palace,where the sultans ruled the vast Ottoman empire and the seat of government was located, there are also several museums there,as well as places to sit around the fountain that is the centerpiece of the square and cafes to sit and watch people while having a cup of tea and a bite to eat.
the best place to be in istanbul. very close to everything. You can go out at night to different places and restaurants and in the day you are at walking distance of the historic part of istanbul

The place to be!. This area has just about anything you might want in Istanbul. There are shops everywhere, and lots to see. Although the Grand Bazaar is a big tourist attraction, I don't think I would go back. They have everything you could possibly want, but you have to constantly fight off the salespeople.

The primary attraction for first time tourists to Istanbul. The map may look large but a very walkable area. The tram also makes it easy for getting around, sorta hop on and hop off. Gotta pick up an Istanbul card or buy single tickets, otherwise.

Historical District. You gona find a lot of Historical area around. You can finished in 1 day. but you have to go early to do visit the historical area to avoid the Cordy. There are a lot of activity around

The centre for tourist attractions.. So much to see in a relatively small area of Istanbul, with the Ayia Sophia, Blue mosque, Hipperdrome, Grand Bazaar, museums galore...tourist well catered for and suprisingly good value in the restaurants around.
One of the best tourist destination in the world. From Grand Bazaar to Egyptian and Spice Bazaar, From Mosques to Muzeums, this is a place to be in Istanbul

.magical!. Having spent several days in this area, we can attest that is is magical. So much to see, many colors, sites, restaurants, activities! Of course there are locals encouraging you to buy, but a firm negative with a kind smile did the trick every time. It's an area of the world in which you will make many memories

exciting historic section of Istanbul but quite "turistic". Even though this area is very tourist centered, there is a lot to do and see. Beware that you will be hounded by many friendly men offering to provide guide services and if not that, they have a carpet business to take you to. Better deals are available elsewhere, even money exchanging rates are better elsewhere. That said, if you politely but firmly decline the offers for services you will enjoy walking around through centuries of history. Enjoy!

The heart of the buzz. Istanbul absolutely buzzes. Sultanahmet is at the very heart of that buzz. Ideal location especially if you've only a short time to explore the ancient and historic sites. Choose a hotel in the middle of Sultanahmet and you'll be within a short walking distance of anything you'll want to explore. An abundance of restaurants - sit outside and watch the inhabitants of this amazing city and tourists from every corner of the earth intermingle.

Must see to be. Can't wait to visit again one day. So much fun and exciting to visit. Must see for anyone going to Istanbul. Be prepared to spend a lot of time in this district. Need minimum of two to three days in my opinion.
Taste of the city. You can not get the taste of the city without visiting Sultanahmet District. Many places to go there and near by. Don't miss it !

Slice of history. The whole district has a wonderful feel - cobbled streets, benches and greenery. All the historical landmarks are walking distance - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofiya, Cistern, Million mark, Topkapi Palace.

Loved this area...... I debated over staying in this area but I'm glad I chose to. Most of the historic sites are within easy walking distance of each other. Lots of shops and restaurants, the tram stop is there to whisk you over to Taksim area if that's where you want to go. I loved be able to walk out of the door of my hotel and within minutes I could sit in the park like atmosphere next to the Blue Mosque grab a snack from a vendor and people watch.

It's all about location, location, location.... This is basically what's referred to old town, or the historic core of the city. This is where you will find the Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia Museum, the Blue Mosque

Not really that impressive. We stayed here and it became pretty familiar in three days. It is very clean and not too crowded, but stores are all the same and a lot of restaurants are overpriced. Good to visit, but explore sights more.....

everything you need is there. you will find everything you need as a toutrist in sultanahmet ditrict historical sites, resturants, old markets and relaxing time in cafes the sea is very closeDislikes : old hotels with small rooms
one of many. nice to visit in Ramadan............but again over priced and lots of people........same of every thing cafes and shops......don't change money here... very poor exchange...

Great area to stay and eat. We stayed in the Sultanahmet area. It is fun to explore the streets and eat at different restaurants.This area include the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Hippodrome, Arasta Bazaar and many restaurants. It is clean and safe to walk late at night. Public transport is within walking distance. Also close to the Grand bazaar, Egyptian spice bazaar and Topkapi.

Most Happening Place. Most happening place in Istanbul. We stayed there for 5 days. Most of the attraction in within walking distance. The night is majestic and the days are colorful. The metro is close so the communication is easier. By the metro one can move to almost all the places of Istanbul. Moreover it is closer to Galata town and Kabatas from there. The grand bazar is also within walking distance. If anyone wants to see the historic Istanbul, Sultanahmet is the place to be.

interesting visit. its a nice place where you can feel the Turkish spirit, enjoy their sweets and run some discussions regarding prices.. always remember that you have to argue for less price with the Turkish people
sultanahmet. beautifula must seevery crowded thoughtry to be there as early as possible so you could get in quickly

Amazing Atmosphere, cheeky stall owners. Careful if you are a foreigner - you are ripped of blindly! As we walked towards the end we got the same stuff at cheaper prices and more honest stalls. I only realised later that I was given the wrong change with the 50 Lira and 10 Lira looking identical!
Egyptian Bazaar. Egypt bazaar market at Sultanahmet district in Istanbul is a place that mix two grand civilizations.

Lovely safe area to stroll.. Make certain.u stay in this area to easily access sites of historical & cultural interest. Stroll beyond the main attractions up the narrow cobbled streets for local cafes & shops. Loads of restaurants & hotels.cool in October so take a rain proof jacket plus a scarf for mosque entry. Haga sofia & dolmabahce palace closed on mondays. Dolmabahce palace also closed on thursdays. City walls closed on tuesdays. Chora museum closed on wednesdays. Spuce market & grand bazaar closed on sundays. Basilica cistern closed after 1300 daily.
Great tourist hangout!. Absolutely loved it during my stay in Istanbul. The place is fun and vibrant with plenty of restaurants, attractions and activities to suit every budget.

Must do on your visit to Istanbul!. Just walking down this street is an experience in its own. Do not buy the first thing you see, as there are different prices of the same things and the vendors can be extra pushy.
fascinating. A fascinating place to visit...... so much history, culture & architecture. The Basilica Cistern is a must see.

Touristy, as expected. All the usual sights here must be seen. Otherwise everything is very much geared toward the tourist. Average carpets and textiles being sold at exorbitant prices. Restaurants with very average food as well. Explore the less travelled laneways and eat where the locals eat. Tram system very useful from what I gather but it's such a pretty place to walk anyway. After experiencing this place and crossing the bridge to the Beyoglu side, I much prefer the latter.

Place i will like to live in Istanbul. The best place for every traveller in Istanbul to stay. Located near the historical places like Blue Mosque, Hagia sophia and egyptian bazaar, the district offers tons of hotel options with very good food options.The place is bustling with crowd and offers good shopping options
The tourist area, but a lot of charm. This is where most of the sightseeing is found, there are some good restaurants along with some touristy ones. Many small hotels and apartments to stay in.

Good place to set up base. Stay in one of the many inexpensive guest houses and small hotels. The standard of amenities are good. We were in the Tria hotel with brilliant breakfast, good rooms, excellent rooftop restaurant and super bathroom... typical because we had a look at some other places. Also the tram runs through the area and so does the sightseeing bus. So communications are good. In addition, of course, you are in the centre of 'old' Byzantium, Constantinople and Istanbul. Stay there.

So much to see. Lots of history and many little shops and restaurants. My husband got a personal turkish shining experience! He enjoyed the flaming blade etc... We had a lovely lunch and enjoyed many friendly conversations with the shop and restaurant owners
Must go there!!!!!!. You are in Istanbul. Go there. If you don´t go, you have not been there. You lost you money. You lost your time.
Must See. So much fun! So much to see! Take your time and look around. Be sure to bargain if you choose to buy something. Also, be sure to check out other vendors to double check prices and quality.

Sultanahmet District. I am looking forward to returning to Istanbul. It's a beautiful city with lots of beautiful, historical buildings to see and enjoy. You can spend hours on this area. Food is also great

Best area of Istanbul. The Sultanahmet District is my favourite area of Istanbul, it is full of great restaurants, shops, Markets and more! You can't go to Istanbul and not visit the Sultanahmet area. I'd recommend staying in the area if you can!

Sounds and smells are intense. This was a busy, assault on the senses and the number of spices and stuff you could buy in each stall was fantastic. A great experience and one you can quickly do in one hour on the way to somewhere else.
Great bargains to be had. Lots of jewelry, silk, good food. If you like silk carpets, load up you credit card, you will need it.

Start your Istanbul visit here. We spent a few days in Istanbul after a long African safari trip. This district has come of the biggest tourist sites. We felt very safe wandering thru the streets. Great people watching to be done. As in all heavily-tourist areas, there are good restaurants and not-so-good restaurants. Ask someone for advice. We hired a tour guide thru our hotel who was able to help us avoid the lines at several historical sites.

The heart of historic Istanbul. Worth many visits!. The classic sights of Istanbul are clustered around this scenic area on the European side of the city. The Golden Horn separates Sultanahmet from the more hip areas of Taksim, Pera and Beyoglu. Many areas are closed to vehicles except public transport (tram) and the Big Bus. We were dropped off by our taxi near the Arasta Bazaar and on another occasion, near the Grand Bazaar - an easy walk to the major sights. You'll see many guides offering their services, but most major sights have very good audio guides, and visitors tend to hire accredited guides from their hotel concierge, websites and tour companies.Aside from being the lodestone of historical Istanbul,encompassing the Hagia Sofia, the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cistern and Hippodrome, a walk around Sultanahmet will take you to the Archeology Museums and most sights listed on the must-see list for visitors. The Big Bus stop is in front of the Hagia Sofia. This area has a huge variety of accommodation including internationally known hotels, locally owned and family operated guesthouses and economical hostels. Sultanahmet has hundreds of restaurants, cafes, food stores and souvenir stores. There are also street vendors with bottles water and seasonal snacks, small parks with benches for weary travelers. Clean paid toilets and the discrete presence of tourist policeDefinitely a safe, comfortable place to spend hours if not days, enjoying the glories of historical Istanbul.
The spirit of Istanbul. This is the heart of Istanbul, the center of its greatest attractions, full of good restaurants, beautiful shops, and artifact sites. One can explore it for days.
Most beautiful part of Istanbul . We stayed in the old part for 3 nights. Wish we could have stayed longer, beautiful buildings. Mosamamazing restaurant
Great Market . But they Double The cost. Its Was A great Trip with Our Guide. I went Watching Every shop. I like The goods But The salesmen double the Rate

So many shops and places to drink and eat. Many creative and colourful small cafes.. People are mostly friendly. You can negotiate prices even though you are not in the big market. There were long queues going to the "pink" museum across the Sultanahmet mosque - and the Sultan's Topkapi palace. As a result we could not enter all the rooms in the palace unless waiting in for a long time.

Love it!. This district is very home-like. I love the restaurants that were there, the warm wine offered there was very nice. The square leading to the tram station was huge! Perfect to walk around with the mosques and tourists around. If i ever go back, I would stay there

center of many attractions. If you stay near sultan Ahmed and close to the tramway you can walk to Aksaray at one direction full of shopping restaurants money exchange and others if you go to the opposite direction from the mosque also good shopping nice walk can reach Gulhane park and even can walk to the sea side with many attractions on the way. Full of tourists safe walk at night

Stay in this area if you can. Everything, from from attractions, to shopping, to restaurants, all are in walking distance. Lots of activities going on till very late. T1 line is right there. Really love this place.

All the major sights!. Blue mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome (obelisks), Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Archaeological Museum, Grand Bazaar (10min walk) etc...the place has everything. Plenty of restaurants (both good and bad).

Sultanahmet area ideal center for the main attractions. We stayed right in the old area at a lovely hotel (Biz Cevahir Hotel). I am partially handicapped (my walking is very slow and limited) but we were able to manage visits to all the major attractions on foot from the hotel. We visited the Basilica Cisterns, the Haga Sofia, The Blue Mosque, the Arasta Bazaar and the Handicraft center. We didn't manage the Topkapi simply because of time, but it was certainly within walking range, even for me. There are simply oodles of local restaurants and bars in the area. For handicapped people like me, you have to be careful and watch your step. The curbs, sidewalks etc. can be broken and/or uneven. Keep your eyes open and you'll be fine.
Traditional part of Istanbul. Feel real Turkey culture in this area.Easy access by public transportation.There are historical sites here besides local shop.
Amazing city. I love Sultanahmet. Ideal area to stay in Istanbul. Amazing cultural vibe. Best restaurants everywhere. All the major sites are within walking distance of each other.
The best and real neighbourhood of Istanbul. Stay here! The best place to stay in Istanbul with all historic sights within walking distance and great views of Sea of Marmara.

Our "base" during our 2015 visit. We stayed at the Golden Crown hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet during our 2015 visit to Istanbul. The area is perfectly located in the heart of all of the tourist spots, everything less than 10 minutes away by tram or on foot. Would recommend to anyone considering visiting this wonderful city
Safe and Fun. So much fun and 100% safe for women traveling alone. We shopped, ate and visited attractions with no problem. Learn to take the Tram, you won't be sorry.

The Heart of the City. Sultanahmet District is the heart of Istanbul. The real Turkish essence are all congregated in this one vibrant place. Starting from restaurants serving traditional kebabs and other authentic Turkish cuisine along with the drink of your choice is available right away. The people around are generous with hospitality. By being close to the river back, the weather during midsummer evening is enjoyable. Shops for some of the best Turkish Delights and Baklava is a cherry on the top. Accommodation is this area is not a matter of worry. Numerous hotels of varying ranges are available. Just be sure to make your reservation in advance since this is a very popular site is always welcoming for tourist. So if you don not want to miss an opportunity to see this place from every bit, plan ahead! And I, as a tourist who added this on my list of favorites, can tell ou that your trip here will be a memorable ride. I intend to go back again, someday!

All historical sights are in same place. Old city were covering Roman empire - Byztian and Ottoman Empire. Therefore full of history you can live, and you can see some samples from each empire.. If you have time let yourself one full day to stay in the old city

Home of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and many other sites. This the place to stay if you want to visit the historic part of Istanbul. It's geared up for tourists. It has good public transport links with rest of the city.

the right place to visit and to stay. a place that you can find it all and have it all. most major attractions are located here or near Sultanahmet. you can also go to anywhere from here with just the no. T1 tram.

Great Market for tourists. Your tourism trip would not be complete if you travel to Istanbul without visiting the Sultanahmet District. That's where the tourism life is! All the souvenirs, foodie, marine recreation etc.

The best place to really get to the heart of touristy Istanbul. Everything you could want is here (except a decent supermarket!). Seriously, this is the heart of historic Istanbul. It is crowded, hilly, dusty and noisy but there are bazaars, tourist shops, cafes, resaurants, bars and several of the main must-see sights of Istanbul all crammed together in a few hundred square meters. You cannot say you have seen Istanbul until you have spent a day wandering the lanes and hills of Sultanahmet.
I would like to live there. This is a very lively street. It is the heart of the old city of Istanbul.A tramway passes by there so you can move to Eminunu or to Beyazit
touring Istanbul. The center of any visit to Istanbul. Walking access to the major mosques and museums. Great food and sights surround you. Easy walking to almost all attractions.

An excellent historic area with everything nearby. Me and my husband loved it here, we loved all the architectual buildings. The area was clean and was being constantly cleaned. Everything is literally nearby and everything is all within walking distance. Lots if restaurants and desert places. Lots of tourist shops too. The amazing beautiful blue mosque. I would really recommend anyone to stay in sultanahmet area it really is beautiful.

Typically Old Istanbul. Plan to spend at least 2 to 3 days in this area. Good hotel for your stay is the Arden City Hotel which is situated within walking from all the attractions.Pedestrian friendly.True taste of Isanbul.

Pearl of istanbul. By visiting sultan ahmet district u will get a feeling of spiritual,strength of one of greatest empire of the world ,great mosque,aiasoffia,great shops and restaurants,grandpazar,and don't miss the dareish cafe.

Awesome attraction.. We walked to sultanahmet from the grand bazaar , just followed the tram tracks and eventually arrived at the blue mosque .. Just fantastic , what an awesome building , respect to the builders so many year ago , no cranes or machines then , just manpower. Beautiful outside but even more beautiful inside , it is a "must see" if you visit Istanbul.

THE place to spend time for first time visitors. If there is but one area to visit this is it. Visitors can enjoy being here for an afternoon or days, depending on how deep they want to explore this historical area.

What a mess. We´ve been advised to rent a room in this district, as this is the historical city center of Istanbul. We´ve never been in Istanbul before, so we did. It was a huge mistake. The term "historical" means junkyard. Every one of 20 buildings were renovated, the rest look really neglected, some of them on the verge of collapse. The public transport is also bad, if present at all in the area, and if you wanna use a taxi, some drivers ask 10 lira, some 50 (!) for the same route. If you plan to visit Istanbul (which is definitely worth it), forget Sultanahmet, and rent a room in Eminönü, which is kinda junction, with life, and good public transport.

Really touristy, when we return we will stay in Galata. This area is very touristy. Galata is more the "artist quarter" & of course plenty touristy, but more relaxed. "Hawkers" dont try to get you in their shops or follow you there. Also if it matters to you far more people in Western dress in Galata, much more muslim/conservative women in the sultanahmet area.

Shopping addicted enjoy this place. something like bazaar but with its own fun, if you don't know Turkish I don't suggest you to go there cause no one can talk with you even a world. i have this problem too. early morning is better to visit otherwise you will get stock between the people.
enjoyed the road walk. must to do walk tour but we missed it as we have short trip. feels excite once you visit the place. Its having tram way and all famous places are near by.

Dazling Display of Goods and Politeness. A local taxi driver took us to this district which was amazing, the colours, smells of spices and displays of goods were breathtaking. One thing that really set this apart from other countries was that once the trader had asked you if they could help they all accepted "No" if that was the case and did not stalk you as often happens in other countries. They were all extremely polite and curtious and were happy to talk to you without the heavy sales pitch. A very pleasent surprize and most welcome. I even tried one of the local toilet's at the cost of 1TRY [a few pence], although this was a tiled hole in the floor, [within a cubicle] it was spotlessly clean with toilet paper and a flushing system plus a lady checking everything was ok after each visit. The hand washing facility was good with both hot water, soap and towels. My opinion of Istanbul and its people [I really didn't have one prior to my visit] has overwelmed me. Thank you for an experience I'll never forget.

The main district . You can find here everything you need!!! famous place, mosque , parks , a lot of restaurants, baklava shops ( hafiz mustafa the best) bazaar ( grand bazaar, spicy bazaar, Astra bazaar)

Turista Tours - Bosphorus & 2 Continents. In the time I had available, I booked the only tour on offer that day, the "Bosphorus and 2 continents" tour. This tour took in some of the finest sights in Istanbul including the Spice Bazaar, the Rustem Pasha Mosque and the amazing Dolmabahce Palace, plus all the wonderful sights from the Bosphorus during the cruise. The total price for the tour was 70 Euros, very good value indeed or a whole day's touring with a good lunch on the Asian side included, and entry to the Palace.The bus itself was modern and very clean, and with air conditioning. Our guide was a very charming young lady with excellent English and a fine knowledge of the city. A brilliant day out. I intend to return to Istanbul to do the other tours!
most important district in Istanbul. One of most important district in Istanbul. the historical place, Spice bazaar, kind of public transportation, a lot of restaurant and crowded street.

Plan on at least two days here in the old city. If you haven't been to Istanbul before, plan to spend a couple of days in this old area of the city. There is so much to see - historical sites, culture, shopping, food and more. One great thing is that is is easy to walk around among the various sites.

Perfect area. We spent four days in this part of Istanbul, and it was a great location. The streets are twisty and full of character. Lots of restaurants and of course carpet sellers! You will be within an easy walk of the Blue Mosque, Kopatki Palace and other attractions. You can also walk along the seawall from this district. There is a range of accommodation price options, we stayed in a hostel, but there are are more elaborate choices too.Even if you do not stay here, wander through the district.

"It's the place to stay". This is the place to stay if you want to experience the true flavour of Istanbul be it food, shopping or sightseeing. After a tiring day you can relax in a nice small restaurant and enjoy original Turkish cuisine and later take a light walk in hippodrome.
Interesting . One of the best district of the city. Sultanahmed Mosque, Aya Sofya & Topkapi palace are situated at this district. That's why I have stayed at hotel near this district.

Must Go Place in Istanbul. Sultanahmet is a must go place in Istanbul. It is where you get to see Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, St. Sophia etc. This area is designed very nicely with clean, traditional streets. You can find a lot of good cafes and restaurants as well as many shops selling leather, gold etc.
Arasta Bazaar. Love the Arasta Bazaar! MUCH less insane than Grand Bazaar! Calmer area, great shops, great neighborhood!

Nice place. Nice place but little crowded , hard to walk with stroller , the prices is little expensive not recommended to buy gifts from there , overall its not bad for young childrens but there is more interesting places.
MUST SEE. wonderful better than the grand loved the people the shops and the Atmosphere just wonderful experience

Sultanahmet Does It Best. What Istanbul does best, in my opinion, is its true antiquities...found on its historic peninsula and mainly in Sultanahmet. Where else can compete with even just the Hippodrome's serpent column I walked past every day...made 2,500 years ago by melting down the shields and weaponry of Xerxes' Persian army when the Greeks defeated them? (Although I'll grant that the much-younger palaces along the Bosphorus are also worth a look. Take the hop-on-hop-off tour by boat for those.)
Tourists paradise. This is really your target. So as a tourist living away from this area is time amd money wasting.Most of attractions are around. Dont forget gulhane park its a tresure.

Sultanahmet! A walk back in time with so much to do and see.... You will step back in time as you get off the congested Istanbul roads taking the narrow streets that squeeze you into Old Town. A sightseers paradise with the Blue Mosque, AyaSofya, Cisterns, Palace, a plethora of eating establishments & stores and more all right here. To get to the modern side is but minutes away by Tram or to the ferries that take you across to the Asian side.  We stayed in a wonderful guest house (the Terrace Guest House) that was centrally located to everything only minutes away. It had the best views of the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorous on its' rooftop.  The restauranteurs stand out trying to entice you into their establishments as there are many to be enticed by. As a westerner it can be unnerving or get old quickly but they're just doing their jobs. They were humorous, lovely and would let you know it if you strolled past them again. For us, it was a fun cultural way of life in this touristy area of Istanbul. Going to the square you will also have adorable young men come up to you giving you suggestions on lines to the mosque, for example. Once you acknowledge them they will find you anytime you walk by somewhat like a Facehugger. You find out they're all selling Turkish Carpets and you'd honor their family to drop by and find out more on how to buy them while there. They're very clever and tenacious but once again, that's the way. The best is to look straight ahead and say no thanks and keep going. Same for the Grand Bazaar. It's a vast land of vendors. The vendors will solicit you right and left and offer you tea to come look at their rugs or whatever. It will be a leisurely affair. Hint-if you accept their tea you are expected to buy something or at least look. Once you haggle, you are expected to buy.  Restaurants of every kind are at your feet. The breads are lovely, the shish succulent and mezzes fresh and aplenty. As it's hot, the Efes beer went down well. I'm a wine person but it was too hot for wine during our stay and Efes worked quite nicely. The Turkish teas (chai) and coffee (kahve) must not be missed either nor the baklava or the lokum or Turkish Delight.  This area is a cultural melting pot and yet so safe. Never once did we feel ill at ease or out of place. There had been tensions earlier around Istanbul but it's a huge city and we never felt any tension. The Turkish people are lovely and their city a pleasure to get to experience. This is a great place to keep you entertained for days.

The old busy istanbul. I stayed at sultanahmet district or area in my last 2 visits to istanbul, one of my favourite places in istanbul where all the historical attractions can be toured by foot... A safe area (especially for girls at night) with attractions, hotels, restaurants, transportation etc... Whatever the tourist wishes will find it there, mostly western tourists like to stay there but you would find it busy all day with tourists and locals.. its part of the old city.. Recommended as its a prime attraction and district.

We walked this area as much as we could. If you go to Istanbul you definitely need to visit this neightbourhood full of life, colour and charm. Carpets stores, Turkish delights shops, restaurants,... you will love it.

“Best don't stay and eat here, just come for sightseeing”. Historic areas, known ultan Ahmet districts accommodate the few sights to be seen in Istanbul from Ottoman and mostly Byzantine times. Above the sights this is probably one of the most decadent areas of the city also hiding many tourist traps in terms of lodging, dining etc. It is a popular believe that a lot of taverns are there, but they are not the best ones. I would highly recommend that you choose some of the nearby districts as Sisli, Besiktas or Ortakoy for lodging and take a ride to the historical sights. By taxi it takes some 20 - 40 TRY per ride.
Great area!. We staid in this area and it was great! All the old attractions are within walking distance. There are a ton of restaurants. The Grand Bazaar is in this area. Everything you need

The heart of old Istanbul . Very nice place to stay in, close to many main attractions in Istanbul like the blue mousqe and Aya Sophia, grand bazaar, spice bazaar top kapi etc... lots and lots of shops and restaurants.

Best food & sights to see. Absolutely loved Old Town. Practically ate my way through every dessert shop! Best baklava I've ever had was from this side of town.Lots of sites to visit in this area. I recommend 2 - 4 days in this area. As you can take your time to enjoy what Istanbul has to offer.Only a 15 minute tram ride to Taksim.

Sightseers Heaven. Loads of attractions in this area of Istanbul from the Blue Mosque to the Grand Bazzar. I stayed in a hotel in this area and found it to be friendly, clean and safe. I was quite comfortable walking around on my own at night and an added bonus is that it is a fairly flat area, important for those of us whose legs tire easily. Plenty of really good restaurants, very little in the way of bars though. Excellent transport available if you want to explore further afield but, depending on how long you are staying, there is easily enough to keep you entertained for two or three days within walking distance. Just a note of warning, none of the vendors will take no for an answer so be prepared to walk away or to be rude and take no notice of what they are saying.
Love it. . I don't know what's so special about this place, but I fell in love with it the first time I saw it. Would definitely be staying in this area next time.

A place worthy of visiting. The district is located in Al Fatih area, in the European part of Istanbul . It has so many attractions such as Hagia Sophia, the great Byzantine church that was turned into a mosque and now as a. museum .From here you can walk to visit Toppkapi palace were the sultans resided. You can never miss the grand Bayazed Bazzar which contains a maze of covered alleys nicely kept and arranged in hundreds of small shops specialzing in antiques,spises and other.silver and gold articles and other Turkish specialities. Sultanahmat district is also where the university of Istanbul is located and has so many Boutiques where one can shop at good prices
A place to get lost in. A really exciting area of the city crammed with restaurants and market stalls and with a great atmosphere to enjoy

Superb visit. It was a nice visit to Sultanahmet district specially the Blue Mosque, hagia sophia, Grand bazar and all.
Highly recommended to walk and see all these place.

History in present time!. Almost all the historical places in Istanbul are near this place. If you get there by public transport mainly Metro/Tram you can roam around and go to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Top Kapi and the Grand Bazar.

Historic Centre of Constantinople and tourist Istanbul. You are spoilt for choice of interesting places to visit in such a small traffic free area of such a large modern city. In this small part of Istanbul you can view St Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. The downside is the length of queues to get into these area. All are well worth viewing.
Best area of Istanbul. Best area of Istanbul. Anything you want, you may easily find it in this district. A combination of cheap and expensive options. Good for any budget!

Be Prepared To Be Accosted. Many locals hang out here to hustle the tourists. Obviously you want to decline the offer to hand over your camera to someone wanting to take your picture. Everyone wants to offer you directions, but they are really directions to their shop.
On the bright side, if you need a selfie stick, this is the place to buy one.

The Old City Buzzing!. We've already spent 2 days in a row here and that's nowhere near enough to explore the whole thing! Be very aware of pickpockets because you're constantly bumping into people with how crowded the place always is. Also be careful of the very high priced restaurants. You'll easily spend anywhere between $15-$25 per person if you're not careful. Small glasses of fresh orange juice cost $4 at least. There are PLENTY or other more inexpensive dining options on the north side of the Grand Bazaar where 2 can eat for less than $15.Other than that it's very lively...lots of police presence that gives you a sense of safety but then you also wonder if somethings wrong.Fun place to be!
have fun. have fun here, don't be rude you can get a bargain without to many problem and the food was very good

Fun but crowded.. It is one of those places you have to experience to make your visit complete. Nonetheless, quite touristic and crowded. Prices are higher than anywhere else, but you will find all you need and want at one place. Easy for transport, trams run frequently and throughout the place. It is also where main attractions are and history of the city.

Tourist spot. It's a tourist spot but it's worth a visit. There's variety of things includes their local delights to be purchase. A piece of advise, don't bargain the price if you don't intend to buy.

Various possibilities!!!. Sultanahmet district offer variety points. Very active and offers various possibilities . If you want to visit Hagia Sofia , the Blue Mosque or you can sit drinking tea and enjoy the lively Sultanahmet

The Old City district is a great place to stay and spend your time.. I love visiting the Old city....there are a LOT of sights and sounds to relish. I stay in the Old city district each time I visit Istanbul for this reason.

Buzzing!. This is a very busy bustling area in Istanbul. Easy for transport, trams run frequently.People are friendly and helpful, most make efforts to speak other languages.It is understood and accepted, that you should haggle when you go to the Grand Bazaar.The Wonderful Blue Mosque just off the main road.It takes its name from the blue tiles decorating the interior. Built by Sultan Ahmet in the 17th century. There are so many beautiful places to see, a longer stay would be ideal. If you are interested in architecture, this is a must for you.You can wander around here in the fragrant gardens to your hearts content, or go inside and survey the history and architecture.Even just sitting by the fountain on the main street, listening to the Call to Prayer is unforgettable. So peaceful. A wonderful memorable city.

Fun and lively. Very lively neighborhood. Fun to walk around and explore the shops. The restaurants in this neighborhood are very touristic so you got to do your research and know in advance where you want to eat.

No trip to Istanbul complete without a visit here. This is the main touristic centre for Istanbul with all the main attractions - so Topkapi, Blue Mosque etc. Lots of shops, hotels and restaurants. it is a fun and vibrant area - which is a must visit - but like all tourist hubs - busy and expensive.

Everything is around . The place is so good food is all around you and the area is full of life as usual. Many shisha places some with live bands programs and others without. The Tram passes there so it easy to go from one place to another. Sultanahmat area is full of historical places for visiting so for those who loves history Sultanahmat is the right place to stay at. It's the old part of istanbul Recommended

A must area to visit or stay in. Very touristy but worth visiting. The Blue Mosque, Hague Sophia, and other must see landmarks are in this area. The Shopping Bazaar (which I did not go to) and the Spice market are all in walking distance of each other

Busy shopping place . Sultanahmet area is full of busy restaurants, shops selling Turkish delight sweets, clothing and jewellery. If you want to buy some momentoes from Turkey can get reasonable price here rather than over publicised grand bazaar.

Gorgeous and bubbly Grand Bazaar. You will never get tired of visiting this beautiful area. There are thousands of shops, both in the streets leading to the Grand Bazaar, and in the Bazaar itself. You can find anything. It is impossible not to buy something to your liking.

Shoppers Paradise. a massive trading area where you can pick up anything you like on your visit, spices , jewelery, textiles. a piece of historical istanbul which has been trading for many centuries. was delightful to spend the day walking round here with lots of dining experiences along the way

long list of attractions/ On your feet / in 2 days !. This is one of the busiest places in Turkey with a long list of attractions side by side. You will need 2 full days on your feet , trust me! Don’t use any transportation between those attractions! You don’t need them!!!1. Start with Sultan Ahmet Bazar. Expensive, but higher quality items to buy with some old style coffee shops and restaurants ..... 2. Then WALK towards the Blue Mosque ( Sultan Ahmat Mosque)... make sure not to go during prayers time....3. Then WALK to Hagia Sophia Museum,4. From there walk again towards TOPKAPI palace..... 5. From TOPKAPI palace you can walk to Basilica Cistern / just across the street..... it's the yellow building on the other corner!.... 6. From there you can walk for half a mile or so towards grand bazar 7. Then it's up to you to go from there down towards Spices bazar through Mahmoud basa street ( one of the most crowded and cheapest streets in Istanbul ) Never go with tourists groups , otherwise your time will be wasted waiting and waiting. discover it yourself, on your feet!..... grab you selfie and enjoy discovering this part of the city....TIP: Don't trust anybody offering you any kind of service in this part of the city….. you don’t need any help…

Very historic place but crowded . There is a lot to discover in Sultanahmet and it is a must in every Istanbul visit. But be aware of tourist scams and hustlers trying to get you to buy stuff there. Any souvenir you will get for just a quarter of the price in the bazar around the Suleyman mosque (NOT the grand bazar).

Worth a Visit. I stayed In the Sultanahmet distant - was interesting stimulating and varied however I would recommend that you don't stay in this area as the calling to prayer and 2.30 and 7.30 does really destroy your sleep patterns!
The palace was my highlight and a took a day to walk the outer wall!
My Visit to Istanbul. It is a very Nice area and Must be visit by every one whom is traveling to Istanbul, you can buy souvenir and nice stuff from there with reasonable Price .

The center of touristic Istanbul. This area is the center of touristic Istanbul, so you can do almost everything you are expecting to do here; sightseeing, walking around, eating and shopping. It's very interesting to see many travellers and local people here, too. There are many historical sights and museums, so it takes a week to see everything around here! The best place to fully enjoy your travel. However, watch out for ripping off! There are many tourist traps around here! Those guys are always hunting for tourists. Never show any interests to them.

Grand Bazaar of Istanbul. A visit to the bazaar is a must when visiting Istanbul. It is an amazing mix of cultures, sounds and aromas, there are 4 thousand shops and creates employment for around 10,000 people. The scope of shopping is boundless, people bustling everywhere and the atmosphere is friendly, courteous and very eager to please. One needs to retain a sense of humour and not be bored by the repetitive stalls as we discovered-in about the tenth leather good shop my husband found exactly the wallet he wanted and at a price he knew to be reasonable. Haggling over prices is taken for granted and adds to the overall enjoyment of both customers and traders. A great way to spend a day.
Great. This is the old city with the main attractions and mosques. Plenty of shops, restaurants. For sure I recommend you stay in this part of the city as everything is close by.
Old meets new. Very quaint area of Istanbul. I stayed in this area twice in September 2015. It's this beautiful mixture of old meets new. Lots of lovely restaurants in the area as well.
Nice area to explore. Great place to see things and experience local stuff. Jumped on the tram and stopped in the heart of it. Great food and sites. Good bargains if off main streets.

Amazing handbags. In this district u can find a lot of leather hand bags shops...Finito De Còrdoba is one of the best with it's good leather quality and the big collection they have... Offering a new interesting experience for shopping fans ..

Stay in Sultanahmet if you enjoy easy access to sights. Safe, friendly and very proud Turkish people in this area.. Walk everywhere.. No need for transport we walked to Galata in under30 mins fine coffee on the way no one hast led u Sirekeci station was worth checking out stained glass fine views from every aspect we followed tram track and did not need a map ..

An Istanbul Treasure. We stayed at the quaint Hotel Buhari Inn, just behind the Arastu Bazaar and walking distance from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. I would highly recommend living in this area; it's pedestrian friendly and close to the two sites above and the Basilica Cistern. Also, two subway stops away from the Grand Bazaar. We went with two young kids and did a lot of walking with them.
need to see. If you come to istambul, you have to see this area. It is the real old town area that you can see all old monuments and buildings

Great to walk around in.. If you're staying in Istanbul for the first time, you should stay in this district. Many of the great sites are here; Hagia Sofya, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace and more. Lots of good restaurants. Just fun to walk around in.

One of the places in Istanbul. Sultan Ahmet area is very beautiful there are so many things to see there staring with the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Top Kapi, but i am not sure that i will ever go back again, and that is becouse of the taxi drivers. in one touristic place like Istanbul i am not able to understand how they can afford to have that bad service,i have seen with my eyes taxi drivers to be violent

a great district with a different facillities. the best distrect you will ever visit its a very big one including alot of historical land marks aya sophia, sultan ahmed mosque and blue mosuqe plus more small places.you will find there any thing you want food delights shops tram station and its very near to the grand bazar 10 Mnts walking distance where you can spend your all day in shoping till 7 PM

Great place. There is a looooot of things you can do in this area. It must go if you are in Istanbul. If you want to book a hotel in this region make sure to book as pay on arrival in order not to be stuck with a bad hotel as I did. Make sure to view the rooms before you pay. The pictures and information that they present only are fake. I can't say all the hotels at least the one.i booked.
Fsbulous place to stay. This is a great place to stay - lots of nice shops, a small bazaar and close to some of the most iconic sites. My favourite area.
Sultanahmet district. Since our hotel Dersaadet was in Sultanahmet area, everything was very close by like Hippodrome, Ble Mosque, Aya Sphia, Topkapi Palace, Arasta Bazaar etc, Very lively place.

Three day trip to Istanbul.. This is a totally wonderful experience and one not to be missed! East meets West in an awesome way! We visited the Blue Mosque, the vast Christian basilica, the grand Bazaar, we walked for miles and took a boat trip sailing up the Bosphorous. The restaurants were superb and not expensive. So much to see and too little time to do it in!
scent of old Istanbul. You ca see the life of ordinary people , their habits and feel their open heart to help you to feel good and enjoy the city

Good place for shopping. Sultanahmet District is a great experience! All the customers are very nice and even if you will not buy from them, they serve you with coffee, tea, sweets and anything else that you want to try.
I had a great experience there and is a nice place to go shopping!
The Heart of Istanbul. This is where the most interesting sights of Istanbul are located. Here are the Mosques, The Cisterns, the best restaurants and many of the best hotels
A Totally Unique Experience. This is truly an unique place in the world. The colours, the smells, the merchandise and the people mean an unforgettable experience.

An assult on the senses. A vibrant and lively area of this wonderful city that really does "get under your skin"
Lots of alley-ways that have some wonderful restaurants and cafe's, all serving local food very reasonably priced.

beauty in every corner !. i like walking there ! u can find a lot of old beautiful buıldings .there are lots of beautiful stunning souvenir shops but many of them over priced .also is a very safe place in my opinion !

A fascinating area of Istanbul. This is a fabulous part of Istanbul that contains the main historical sights and many great shops and restaurants. It can get very dark at night but is perfectly safe. We stayed here as it was only a short walk to all the main sights and ate in a few restaurants. All were excellent. Istanbul is a huge city so it is good to have all these things on your doorstep.
Great Atmosphere. A huge assortment of shops selling everything from the usual tourist tat to fine antiques. Filled with a number of mıd to high class restaurants, bars and cafes.

Shops and sights galore. Sultanahmet is a vibrant area worth exploring. You can visit The Grand Bazaar, mosques, Topkapi Palace, lots of souvenir shopping. It's easily accessible by the tramway and locals are happy to help you out with directions. A very friendly precinct.

Loved this area!. We stayed in the sultanahmet district this past week and loved it! Everything we needed was walking distance from our hotel (Sura Design Hotel) The grand bazar, Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque the basilica Cistern and Topkaki Palace are all walking distance from eachother here in the Sultanahmet District. Not to mention all the delicious resteraunts, dessert shops, souvenir shops and shisha cafes!

A less bazaar bazaar. We found this place much less hectic, and easier place to shop than the Grand Bazaar. You need to experience the Grand Bazaar for fun, then do your serious shopping here. Most of the same items are available. Our tour guide indicated that even some locals shop here which is a good sign. One of our favorite shops was Hayat which is about the third store in, on the right side of the main entrance (mosque side). Very well known for quality spices. Enjoy
The Colorful Sultanahmet District. Don;t miss the colorful Sultanahmet District during your visit to Istanbul, Turkey. It is a beautiful experience for your eyes and ears and taste buds.
The old city. old city, but nothing old about it. A fine mix of old and new. the area is fully geared up for tourists. very helpful people and more than eager to be friendly

Explored the farmer's market, local restaurants besides the mosques, museums and squares.. This is a tourist's paradise. So much to do in a small area - cultural, historic and food related. Perfect area to stay and explore on foot. 1 week is not enough.

sightseeing!. this time around i chose to stay in the sultanahmet area it was very nice!.. and i got a terrific deal for a hotel.... everthing in close range...and the sights were breathtaking and very close by about a 3-4minute walk away!...
Very nice area!. I recommend staying in this area. Ver safe and with various alternatives in walking distance. Many Restaurants are also in the area. Very nice place to for walk tours!

Tourist heaven. This is the Old part of Istanbul where you will find all the major tourist attractions and sights. It's clean safe and the people are friendly and helpful. It gets very crowded with tour groups. Best to visit the attractions early in the morning before the crowds arrive.Great location to stay in as you can walk to everywhere worth visiting.

Essential start of meandering walk ... Get the tram there & plan your way back towards bridge (for Tunel subway/funicular & historic tram to Taksin Square). Blue Mosque (if you queue), Cistern essential (and different), Palace, etc
Best district in Istanbul. That is the place what I like much more, hope I can visit it every year.Recommended to everyone not to visit only but to stay in this area at least for 3 nights.

48 hours. We were four (older) Australian women and only had 48hours in Istanbul - what a shame it wasn't longer. We stayed at Timeks Hotel in Sultanamet, a small family-run place which was fabulous, clean, delightful staff and easy walking distance to major attractions plus close to the trams. Not to be missed.
SPEND SPEND SPEND. Visit the area ! There are so many things to buy you would probably need a truck to carry it all. Perfect place to find a present like Turkish Delight !
Sultanahment. We stayed in Sultanahmet and would recommend it to anyone. Its walking distance to almost all of the attractions and the variety of the restaurants around are great.

You had better not try the Sultanahmet McDonalds. You can see lots people from all over the world. Lots of nice and traditional retaurants and cafes.But I do not recommend The Sultanahmet McDonalds because we ordered some food for three people which would cost about 50 TL but to our surprise, the cashier/sales boy gave us a bill of 65 TL!!! We asked for explanation and kind of objected to the total price but he got upset and said angrily that the kind of dish we had ordered was not available so he promptly replaced it with some other dish+ big size coke and big size packet of French fries WITHOUT telling us in the first place!!!...Finally they said we had to pay the 65TL bill because when a bill is printed, one cannot change the food or ask for a refund!!!!
Great. This neighborhood is a treat to stroll through. From the scent of spices, to the array of rug dealers all around you shouldn't miss this.

Historical. You have to stay in the historic Sultanahmet District. It has all the attractions, I.e., Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome of Constantinople, Obelisk of Theodosis, Topkapi palace, Grand Bazaar and more. We found the line at the Blue Mosque, extremely long, so toured the grounds, but chose to visit another Mosque rather than stand in line for at least an hour. There are many unique Boutique hotels, restaurants, spice bazaar and the Bosphorus are all within walking distance. The tram also runs through the district for quick transportation.

Great area. Stayed here for 4 nights. Fantastic, full of interesting places to visit. 4 days was only just long enough to see everything. Another day or two would have enabled us to do things at a more relaxed pace.

Good place for the touristy things of Istanbul. I dont mind coming here one off when in Istanbul but it is mainly aimed at tourists only, if staying in a hotel i would recommend staying in the Cihangir District in Taksim area you experience the real life in Istanbul and it is alot more peaceful, relaxed and ofcourse alot better restaurants

Enough for Several Days of Sight Seeing. Visit the Spice Market, The Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Basilica Cistern, The Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, and the Hippodrome. Stroll along the banks of the Golden Horn. Check out the restaurants on the Galata Bridge.

Liveliest part of Istanbul. I allways stay in Sultanahmet when in Istanbul, it can be easily reached by metro and tramway from the airport and the choice for hotels is vast. It is also full of tourists but this doesn't bother me too much as they are mainly individuals and from all over the world, so elderly cruiseship passengers don't prevail. You will quickly find a restaurant or cafeteria to your taste and the area is also full of smaller shops where buying is easier than in the Grand Bazaar. The most interesting main sights, the two Mosques, Cistern Basilica and Topkapi palace are all close by. The tram will take you down to Galata andover to Karaköy when you need to see more.

Perfect location to stay.. We booked our hotel in this area, Dosso Dossi, with an amazing location. The best way to feel real Istanbul is stay in Sultanahmet area. And our suggestion is to stay at least 5 days to discover all sightseeings properly.
Great place to visit. . Very nice place. Many great historical landmarks. Highly recommended for everyone visiting Istanbul. Very nice place to relax, eat, or shop.

Sultanahmet District. Great shopping & wonderful sight-seeing. I felt completely safe even walking around at night. Found some very special fez hats - they have restarted an old & abandoned business in Turkish hats!

i want to go back!. i think this is the best place to go to and visit if you have only a couple of days in istanbul! the most important places to visit are within walking distance...shopping for local items is nearby...the baklava and turkish coffee shops are everywhere..including bakeries and canteens which the locals buy from p so its good, filling and cheap!!!
In the heart of the city. Tourist area but has a buzz. Restaurants aplenty with reasonable food and usually wine and beer. Small shops. Encouraged into restaurants and shops but in good natured way.

A High Energy, Senses-Assaulting Exerience You Just Can't Miss. You just have to do this for yourself; there is no way to describe it in words. Of course, there are so many shops with so many things to look at and buy, but the atmosphere is just as much of an attraction as the shop keepers offerings. Even though there are folks walking around trying to sell you things, if you ignore them, they will be persistent, but not highly annoying as in other countries I have visited. This is a high energy, senses assaulting experience not to be missed
History. Sultanahmet district has a lot of historical context. Sultanahmet mosque and high sofia are one of them. You can walk around it and find other places. It will be so good
everything u need. everything is a walking distance from here. plenty of historical attractions. many gift shops with reasonable prices and countless food shops and restaurants.

Perfect place to stay in Istanbul. Sultanahmet district gives you a true feel of Istanbul and the history it has. The narrow by-lanes going uphill and downhill are just lovely. I stayed at a studio apartment near Hippodrome Square. The Hippodrome square where the historical attractions are located is at the heart of Sultanahmet. There are ample places for dining suiting various budgets.

A perfect visit!!!. Walking through out the District was an experience itself. The food, the amazing selection of teas, the nargile cafes, the grand bazaar, the spices or mpaharia like they call them......just amazing!!!!!
What an atmoshere. We came back to this area almost every day, as you cannot beat the views and atmosphere around the Hagia Sohpia and Blue Mosque
A must see.. So many historic sights so close together- all within walking distance! You can't leave Istanbul without a visit.

eat place to stay. We stayed in this area and there is a godd choice of places to eat and small shops to buy water, snacks, alcohol etc. Its on a short walk to the main sites in the area and the tram stop which takes you to the port or across to the main shopping district. Its nice to walk around at night after the buildings are light up.
This is the district to stay!. Sultanahmet District is where all the major sights are located. Being in this area means everything is within walking distance
Sultanahmet. Sultanahmet was an interesting place that all important sightseings in İstanbul that you can see in one place in one day.

Centre of Old Istanbul. Busy, interesting, plenty of restaurants, close to many major attractions, this area is excellent for touring old Istanbul. Well served by trams, but can easily walk everywhere with ease.

Fascinating experience. Well worth a four or five day visit to see exotic Istanbul with amazing mosques the Brand Bazzar good value restaurants and friendly and helpful people but watch out for the carpet and restaurant touts
Very special!. A very different and fun experience. Even though I have a hard time with all the sellers trying to make me buy stuff!

It would be ridiculous to go to Istanbul and not visit Sultanahmet. That would be like visiting London and not seeing the houses of parliament or Paris and not seeing the Eiffel Tower. It is an historic district and must be seen! That said it is an historic district and must be seen.

For food and history lovers - the Sultanahmet District. If you're visiting Turkey only once, make it to the Sultanahmet District, rich in history, easy to walk around and explore, lots of great places to eat and very close to Eminonu (where the fish sandwich is to die for) and the Galata Bridge. Ayia Sofia, the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosqua and Basilica Cistern all easy to reach in this district. You can also spend some time under the sun in the square where chariot races were held many years before

Love it. Sultanahmed district is full of history, traditional coffee shops and restaurants. I love the atmosphere there and always busy with tourists not only abroad but also from other cities of Turkey.
Lovely.. Brilliant - lots of little shops and a lots of bargains to be had. The people are hugely friendly and I felt very comfortable there.

Beautiful area . Sultanahmet district is a beautiful area has many of Istanbul’s historical sights ,in addition to great variety of shops,cafes and restaurants.
Getting to the old City by public transport is easy .Best thing is to buy Istanbul card
and travel easily by the modern tram lines which covers the whole city.
Nice part of Istanbul. The Sultanahmet District of Istanbul has many shops selling sweets, Turkish Delights, and herbs and spices. Good bazaar type atmosphere.

Centre of all attractions. It is right in centre of Istanbull. All the landmarks like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazar are nearby. A great place for shopping with lot of restaurants.

Istanbul.. excellent restaurants, we never had a bit of trouble with the menu's and the restaurant street walkers kept you entertained and ushered you to great eateries, especially trying local dishes cooked in pots and opened at your table, cannot remember the name of them.Had a relaxing Hamas, by boy friend and girlfriend, that was an experience. Felt safe walking around at night, although we never ventured far from the back streets. Pick up from this area was easy enough for our tours to gallipoli and Troy.

Be transported back to past decades in Sultanahmet. Miles and miles and miles of history. Everywhere you look is a piece of what was there hundred of years before. If only we could preserve our physical history as good as the Turkish! Good food, great view. And great ice-cream, too...
Bazaars!. Grand bazaar and Spice market bazaar are both fantastic. Much cleaner and organized that I had imagined. We shopped with a local friend, so we got the best prices.
Nothing special. Nothing special, reall crowded and overpriced. Try to go to the smaller, oposing streets just to find the same thing half-price (food included)
The main tourist area. The main tourist area and takes days to fully discover all the gems of Istanbul that lurk nearby. Get a guide to get the best benefit from your visit.

everything is close. our hotel was in Sultanahmet District, and it is a great place, because everything is so close, shopping malls, restaurants, Ayasofya, the Blue mosque, Basalica Cistern and all the important places in Istanbul are very close
Center of it All. Prime location to stay in while visiting Istanbul. Great food, shopping and close to all the landmarks
shop till you drop. the best place for shopping and eating turkish dishes and dessert very nice place for spending a great night buy all what you need for gift and souvenir with great prices

Busy area with lots to see and do very convenient for main sites. We stayed in the Sultanahmet district so we were close to most of the attractions we wanted to visitThere are a variety of resturants and some very annoying waiters! Every place you walk someone tries to get you to eat or view their shop!We spent a lot of time walking up or down hill so pack comfy shoesWe felt safe walking around there were families with their children out till late at night. This is not a posh area it is run down especially a street or so away from the main road.
Historical Place. one of the best district to stay and visit. al historical places are in this area and in near vicinity. lots of cafe, shops to roam and shop around.

A place to put on your bucket list. Stayed in Sultanahmet and loved the convenience. Most main attractions are in walking distance. There are so many pedestrians that they limit taxi access to the city significantly in the evening after sundown. The area is clean and the restaurants offer a wonderful variety of foods and very reasonable prices and with lots of fresh ingredients.

Best area for shopping.. Sultanahmet offered the best places to shop and dine. Many choices of restaurants with great value. Also a good neighbourhood to stay as all the attractions are within walking distance.
food nightlife. Wonderful area, especially during nightime, there are plenty nice restaurants that serve turkish and oriental food and of course turkish Tea (Tchay)
Loved it. I simply loved the place, the best place to shop specially for souvenirs, sweets, yummy Turkish food and night life.
very nice area. one of the most amazing part in Istanbul.you can spend all the day walking and discover new thingsits better to book hotel in this area

WELL KEPT HERITAGE SITES ALL WITHIN WALKABLE DISTANCE. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Place and Hippodrome all within walkable distance, are the very well maintained and easily accessible by foot.
